builds.title: Try to Leave a Dent
builds.description: Lane dominance kill threat and map roaming

primary_data.stone_why: Leona's all-in style of gameplay heavily revolves around jumping on your target and killing them as fast as possible. Aftershock's explosion damage further pushes your ability to kill the enemy after CCing them.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Damage: 40-140 (+3.5% your maximum health)
Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: Engage your target, kill, and punish them by dealing massive amounts of damage to the tower while they respawn.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Charge up a powerful attack against a tower over 4s, when within 600 range of it. The charged attack deals 125 (+30% of your max health) bonus physical damage.

Cooldown: 45s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tower burst damage based on max health.

primary_data.stone_why: Conditioning on Leona is great once you've hit the 10min mark as both the bonus Armor and MR contribute to your [W] strength.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: After engaging, Second Wind allows you to regenerate health mid-fight and chase down your target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

secondary_data.stone_why: Leona's all-in and CC heavy play-style makes Cheap Shot a great option for that extra bit of damage when looking to make a pick and kill your target as quickly as possible.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging champions with impaired movement or actions deals 12 - 30 bonus true damage (based on level).

Cooldown: 4s
Applies to damage occurring after the impairment.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus true damage to impaired (slowed etc.) champions.

secondary_data.stone_why: Relentless Hunter's extra bit of out of combat Movement Speed empowers your ability as Leona to roam the map and easily get into range to land your [E] and make picks.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.24
patch.description: Patch 7.24 is the first major balance pass at the new rune system and touches a number of of runes throughout including buffs to Fleet Feetwork and Phase Rush, nerfs to Press the Attack and Triumph and many more.

builds.title: Bloodshed Carries a Price
builds.description: Lethality focused long range poke with [Q].

primary_data.stone_why: Arcane Comet synergizes well with Varus' Lethality build because the adaptive physical damage of Comet will hit extra hard thanks to all of the Lethality you're building.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Band allows you to massively sustain mana once you have built Tear of the Goddess, empowering you to continuously deal more poke damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: Lethality poke on Varus requires proper positioning in the backline of your team so that you can safely deal damage from a distance.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch's extra bit of burn damage in the lane phase allows you to keep up continued poke pressure.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: The extra bit of healing from Triumph allows you to trade those close all-in 2v2s in lane and pick up the double kill once one of the enemy champion dies.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace is the go-to rune of choice on champions who can deal damage to backline squishy targets.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Press the Attack pairs nicely with Varus's natural attack speed and % max health damage on his [W]. A few auto attacks and you'll be shredding any champion on the rift.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 consecutive basic attacks will deal 30 - 120 bonus adaptive damage (based on level) and makes them vulnerable, increasing the damage they take by 12% from all sources for 6s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Taking Triumph lets you fight to the death and hold your group for the kill, coming out the other side with massive health to keep fighting.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Like most Ad Carries, Varus loves to auto attack and the Attack Speed from Legend: Alacrity provides plenty in conjunction with his Passive.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 0.8% life steal for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Life Steal stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace is the most reliable damage rune in this group. The extra execution presence on squishies helps you win out in close 2v2 fights in the bot lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Taste of Blood allows you to take small trades with lane with your 3-stack [W] proc and [E] and come out ahead on health.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal when you damage an enemy champion.

Healing: 18 - 35 (+0.20 bonus AD, +0.1 AP) health (based on level).

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Heal when you damage champions.

secondary_data.stone_why: Ravenous Hunter allows you to heal for massive amounts on a full [W] blight proc. paired with the exposure bonus from Press the Attack.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Healing: 2.5% + 2.5% per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Nautilus is one of the premier users of Aftershock thanks to his numerous forms of CC. His passive, [Q], and [R] with all grant you the bonus Armor and MR for surviving trades/all-ins.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Damage: 40-140 (+3.5% your maximum health)
Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: Font of Life is a fantastic support Nautilus rune choice thanks to his ability to easily proc the effect on a large number of enemy champions in teamfights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them for 4s.

Ally champions who attack marked enemies heal for 5 + 1% of your max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Allies heal when attacking enemies you impair | Think old Stoneborne Pact.

primary_data.stone_why: Iron Skin is the defacto rune choice for melee supports as the early armor allows you to take trades in lane efficiently.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: Revitalize empowers your defensive utility as a support. The bonus healing/shielding applies to Font of Life, Redemption, Locket and your [W].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

secondary_data.stone_why: Biscuit Delivery is a fantastic sustain option for tank champions in lane any. The Biscuit heals for a % of your missing health, so if you proc it in a fight when you're relatively low you'll gain massive regen.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Biscuit Delivery: Gain a Total Biscuit of Everlasting will every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes.

Biscuits restore 15% of your missing health and mana and increase your mana cap by 40 mana permanently.

Champions without mana restore 20% missing energy instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Periodically gain a biscuit with strong Health/Mana regen.

secondary_data.stone_why: Celestial Body on Nautilus support allows you to tank the brunt of damage in early lane trades with your massive health pool. The extra health also slightly empowers your Font of Life healing and [W] shield.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+100 Health permanently
-10% damage to champions and monsters until 10 mins.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +100 health | Less damage until 10 minutes.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Aery is taken here for it's reliability and chip damage when trading with [Q].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging enemies or shielding allies.

Damage: 15 - 40 based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD)
Shield: 30 - 80 based on level (+0.25 AP and +0.4 bonus AD)

Aery cannot be sent out to again until she returns to you.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks/abilities summon Aery to damage enemies / shield allies.

primary_data.stone_why: Nullifying Orb lets you take aggressive trades/fights into high-threat AP mages during laning phase.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Upon taking magic damage that would reduce Health below 30%, grants a shield that absorbs 40 - 120 magic damage based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD) for 4 seconds.

Cooldown: 60s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Grants a magic shield when taken to low health by magic damage.

primary_data.stone_why: In the mid to late game, Viktor has a nearly constant haste thanks to his empowered [Q]. The bonus Movement Speed from [Q] will grant you a bit of an AP steroid.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Combined with Aery, Scorch is a great rune for taking small trades and chipping away at the enemy in lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Future's Market plays a huge role in overcoming Viktor's pain points of rough buy-timings when rushing his Hex Core upgrades.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
You can enter debt to buy items. The amount you can borrow increases over time.

Debt limit: 150 + 5/min
Lending Fee: 50 gold per item
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Enter debt to buy items early.

secondary_data.stone_why: Biscuit Delivery provides a great amount of sustain during lane so you can more reliably back on better buy-timings.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Biscuit Delivery: Gain a Total Biscuit of Everlasting will every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes.

Biscuits restore 15% of your missing health and mana and increase your mana cap by 40 mana permanently.

Champions without mana restore 20% missing energy instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Periodically gain a biscuit with strong Health/Mana regen.

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Like Courage of the Colossus, Sejuani can reliably proc it for the bonus defenses and extra bit of damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Damage: 40-140 (+3.5% your maximum health)
Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: All 4 of Sejuani's abilities can easily proc Font of Life, and because you naturally stack health the on-hit heal adds up to be considerable for fights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them for 4s.

Ally champions who attack marked enemies heal for 5 + 1% of your max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Allies heal when attacking enemies you impair | Think old Stoneborne Pact.

primary_data.stone_why: As a jungler, early game armor allows you to sustain longer clears while remaining healthy for fights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: Because you naturally itemize stacking a lot of health as Sejuani, Overgrowth doubles-down on that by providing a lot of bonus scaling health based on how much health you've built.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 8 monsters or enemy minions that die near you permanently increases your max health by 0.2%.

Range: 1400 units
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Minions that die nearby give max health.

secondary_data.stone_why: Sweeping Lens and Control Wards are the mainstay of a jungler. Why not benefit by getting extra vision for yourself when you go on a ward-clearing spree.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

secondary_data.stone_why: It's important for a jungler to be able to quickly react and get to a skirmish happening anywhere on the map. Relentless Hunter gives you the Movespeed Speed necessary to get there and win.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: The bonus Life Steal allows you to stack even more Press the Attack attack during trades.

Gain 0.8% life steal for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.

primary_data.stone_why: Execute your target and proc your [R] heal as soon as possible.

Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Your [Q] easily proc Sudden Impact giving you free Lethality.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

secondary_data.stone_why: Snowball from kills and skirmishes to gain some extra damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain an adaptive bonus of 0.6 Attack Damage or 1 Ability Power, per eyeball collected.

Upon completing your collection at 20 eyeballs, gain an adaptive bonus of 6 Attack Damage, or 10 Ability Power.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

primary_data.stone_why: Overheal is a great rune for topping off your heal to sustain chip damage from the enemy, and synergizes well with the Life Steal from BotRK and Bloodline.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Excess healing on you becomes a shield, for up to 10% of your total health + 10.

Shield is built up from 40% of excess healing from self, or 300% of excess healing from allies.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Excess incoming heals become a shield (includes lifesteal etc.)

primary_data.stone_why: More Life Steal means longer trades equalling Lucian gets off more Passive procs and Press the Attack damage.

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.

After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.

primary_data.stone_why: As an artillery mage, Ziggs is able to repeatedly proc Comet from safety. His low cooldown on [Q] also allows him to refresh the Comet cooldown quickly.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: Ziggs is a champion who can apply a lot of lane pressure with [Q] harass and Scorch procs. Manaflow Band gives you the mana sustain to keep up the pressure.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: With Transcendence you're able to hit 40% CDR with just Morello's and Lich Bane. With such a low CD on [Q] you can shred towers with your passive, Lich Bane, and [W].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Between frequent comet procs and Scorch, Ziggs can can rain down lane pressure from afar with accurate [Q]s.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: More CDR means more harass and more passive procs on towers for that juicy [W] tower execution.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

secondary_data.stone_why: Biscuits are a great rune choice for lane sustain as well as providing a bit extra mana for all that harass you'll be spittin' out.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Biscuit Delivery: Gain a Total Biscuit of Everlasting will every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes.

Biscuits restore 15% of your missing health and mana and increase your mana cap by 40 mana permanently.

Champions without mana restore 20% missing energy instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Periodically gain a biscuit with strong Health/Mana regen.

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Aery synergies incredibly well with Lulu's play-style mix of offensive lane pressure and late-game shielding. Makre sure to pick up Aery as often as you can to make full use of her.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging enemies or shielding allies.

Damage: 15 - 40 based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD)
Shield: 30 - 80 based on level (+0.25 AP and +0.4 bonus AD)

Aery cannot be sent out to again until she returns to you.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks/abilities summon Aery to damage enemies / shield allies.

primary_data.stone_why: The Ultimate Hat allows you the freedom to use Wild Growth more offensively and liberally when fighting skirmishes without worry of it being on cooldown for a teamfight.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

primary_data.stone_why: Transcendence is a great rune choice for most mages and supports as repetitive spell casts is the majority of their damage/utility, and pairs well with Ultimate Hat.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Paired with Summoner Aery, Scorch grants Lulu fantastic lane power and harassment chip damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: As a support placing wards is one of your primary duties. Zombie Ward doubles down on that and scales incredibly well the more wards you place during the game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

secondary_data.stone_why: The combination of Summon Aery, Scorch, and Cheap Shot gives any early game offensive Enchanter the ability to deal an incredible amount of damage in skirmishes while building no damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging champions with impaired movement or actions deals 12 - 30 bonus true damage (based on level).

Cooldown: 4s
Applies to damage occurring after the impairment.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus true damage to impaired (slowed etc.) champions.

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

builds.title: Their Time is Short
builds.description: Summoner Spell cooldown abuse for aggressive picks with Flash->[R].

primary_data.stone_why: Unsealed Spellbook allows you to heavily abuse your Summoner CDR with Lucidity Boots for aggressive picks with Flash->[R].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain a Summoner Shard at 2 minutes and another every 6 min after (max 2 shards).

While near the shop, you can exchange 1 Summoner Shard to replace a Summoner Spell with a different one.

Additionally, your Summoner Spell cooldowns are reduced by 25%.

Smite: Buying Smite won't grant access to Smite items
You cannot have two of the same Summoner Spell
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Swap summoner spells in game. 25% Summoner CDR.

primary_data.stone_why: Perfect Timing is a great rune in situations where enemy mid has dive potential on you and you want to make the out-play.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

primary_data.stone_why: Magical Footwear allows you to get an earlier and cheaper Boots of Lucidity empowering your ability to make aggressive picks with Summoner Cooldowns.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: You get Slightly Magical Boots at 10 min, but you cannot buy boots before then. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free boots at 10 minutes.

primary_data.stone_why: The extra bit of CDR and Summoner CDR from Cosmic Insight even further enables your potential to abuse your short Flash cooldown.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

secondary_data.stone_why: The extra bit of Movement Speed from Celerity comes up big when just outside of range for a well-timed ult.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Scorch provides fantastic early-game lane pressure for poke and harassment so that you're able to keep the enemy in kill range when you hit level 6.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

builds.title: Suppression Into Oblivion
builds.description: Lane shove, early skirmishing, and [R] spam.

primary_data.stone_why: Malzahar's kit allows him to repeatedly proc Comet on cooldown and reduce it's cooldown effectively with [E] and [W]. Once you've purchased Rylai's your comet hit-rate will skyrocket.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: The more your [R] up the more kills you can secure for your team. Paired with Transcendence and Cosmic Insight you'll have your Ultimate up for any fight or skirmish.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

primary_data.stone_why: Celerity is a great rune on Malzahar largely thanks to the passive Movement Speed. The extra bit of speed allow you to get into range of that clutch [R] that you might not otherwise be able to get.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: The option here is really a personal preference. Scorch is great for lane harass and early fights while Gathering Storm is great for scaling and pairs well with Magic Penetration.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Malzahar loves CDR for both his [R] and harassing/shoving in lane with [E]. Assuming you've completed Morello's, you'll already be at 35% CDR and incredibly strong at 10min.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

secondary_data.stone_why: Magical Footwear is a great rune choice for simply saving money so you can hit your damage power-spikes that much sooner.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: You get Slightly Magical Boots at 10 min, but you cannot buy boots before then. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free boots at 10 minutes.

patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Like Thunderlords, Electrocute is quite easy for Zed to proc and gives him great kill threat.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Sudden Impact is easily procced by Zed from [W] or [R] granting the Lethality needed for the kill.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: Zed is all about the kills and Eyeball Collection rewards you for doing so by granting you more damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain an adaptive bonus of 0.6 Attack Damage or 1 Ability Power, per eyeball collected.

Upon completing your collection at 20 eyeballs, gain an adaptive bonus of 6 Attack Damage, or 10 Ability Power.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Movement Speed is a key stat for hunting down and finding an angle on your prey and Relentless Hunt helps you find those openings.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Zed loves CDR through his itemization and Transcendence doubles down on that. It also allows you to build every Lethality item without worrying about going over the CDR cap.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Nullifying Orb is a key rune in this loadout as it's an integral part in surviving hard AP matchups. Think of it as a free hexdrinker.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Upon taking magic damage that would reduce Health below 30%, grants a shield that absorbs 40 - 120 magic damage based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD) for 4 seconds.

Cooldown: 60s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Grants a magic shield when taken to low health by magic damage.

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.description: Patch 7.24 is the first major balance pass at the new rune system and touches a number of of runes throughout including buffs to Fleet Feetwork and Phase Rush, nerfs to Press the Attack and Triumph and many more.

builds.title: Another Body for the Gutter
builds.description: Back-line execution damage and lane safety.

primary_data.stone_why: Electrocute on Talon allows you to blow up enemy champions quickly and easily on roams with [R]->[Q]->[W].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Talon is a fantastic user of Sudden Impact thanks to [Q] acting as a dash. The extra bit of Lethality allows you to deal massive amounts of damage when going for the assassination.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: Zombie Ward allows you to keep yourself safe in lane with massive river vision control. Hug the side of the lane that you have warded so that you're able to es cape safely if the jungler appears on the opposite side.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

primary_data.stone_why: Relentless Hunter's bonus Movement Speed massively empowers your ability to leave the mid lane and pressure the side lanes with quick roams. Talon loves traversing the map as quickly as possible, and Relentless Hunter is key to that.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Triumph allows you to dive towers or the back-line with an all-in combo and the ability to get out alive afterward, thanks to the massive heal.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace is the ultimate rune for assassins looking to execute squishy targets. The bonus damage is easily accessible on a high damage kit such as Talon's.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Bloodline synergizes incredibly well with Draven bonus damage on [Q] and the exposure damage of Press the Attack, allowing you to duel and sustain in lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 0.8% life steal for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.

Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Celerity's bonus Movment Speed grants you a little freedom in catching axes. At also allows your [W] to become a small AD steroid.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Gathering Storm is your late game insurance policy on damage. Draven is not typically an AD Carry that scales well into the late game, but Gathering Storm helps patch up some of those issues.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 10 min. gain AP or AD, Adaptive.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD
20 min: + 24 AP or 14 AD
30 min: + 48 AP or 29 AD
40 min: + 80 AP or 48 AD
50 min: + 120 AP or 72 AD
60 min: + 168 AP or 101 AD
etc...

primary_data.stone_why: Zombie Ward is a fantastic all-around rune choice on any champion thanks to it's incredibly reliable and effective addition of vision.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

primary_data.stone_why: The bonus healing Ravenous Hunter grants minimizes risk when looking to take aggressive trades and all-ins.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Healing: 2.5% + 2.5% per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Triumph allows you to dive towers or the back-line with an all-in combo and the ability to get out alive afterward, thanks to the massive heal.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace is the ultimate rune for champions that are looking to execute squishy targets. The bonus damage is easily accessible on a high damage kit such as Riven's.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

rune_main.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Show Them the Horns
builds.description: Ranged matchups: Lane sustain and diving tankiness.

primary_data.stone_why: Aftershock's massive addition of tankiness allows Ornn to dive into the enemy team during fights with [E] and absorb a ton of damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Damage: 40-140 (+3.5% your maximum health)
Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: Unflinching allows you to stick to enemy champions for a Brittle auto in fight fights. Ornn is incredibly susceptible to being kited before he can get into position for an [E] knock-up.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance by 10% for each Summoner Spell on cooldown. After casting a Summoner Spell, gain 15% additional Tenacity and Slow Resistance for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

primary_data.stone_why: AD Matchups: In tough ranged AD matchups (Jayce/Quinn) take Iron Skin to help you survive in lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: Revitalize's bonus shielding is incredibly strong paired with the shield from Ornn's [W], allowing you to absorb a lot more damage well timed well.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

secondary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Band grants you the mana sustain you need to stay in lane as long as possible so that you're able to effectively use your passive and abuse item power-spikes.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

secondary_data.stone_why: Celerity's bonus Movement Speed grants you the bonus speed necessary to stick your target in fights and position for a well-placed [E] knock-up.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.24
patch.description: Patch 7.24 is the first major balance pass at the new rune system and touches a number of of runes throughout including buffs to Fleet Feetwork and Phase Rush, nerfs to Press the Attack and Triumph and many more.

primary_data.stone_why: Like the old Grasp, but better. Ornn is always looking for auto attacks when trading because he want's to proc his brittle.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 4s in combat, your next basic attack on a champion will:

  • Deal bonus damage equal to 4% of your max health
  • Heal you for 2% of your max health
  • Permanently increase your health by 5

Ranged Champions: Damage and healing are halved and gain 2 permanent health instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus damage / heal based on max health. Permanent max health.

primary_data.stone_why: Ornn can quite easily apply Font to a large number of targets in teamfights with [Q], [E], and [R]. Stacking health will provide a lot of healing to teammates.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them for 4s.

Ally champions who attack marked enemies heal for 5 + 1% of your max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Allies heal when attacking enemies you impair | Think old Stoneborne Pact.

primary_data.stone_why: As a top laner you'll be building a lot of Armor and Magic Resist allowing granting Conditioning a lot of value in bonus resists.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: Lane sustain is the name of the game for Ornn because he doesn't have to recall for items. Second Wind provides your needed health regen. after trades.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

secondary_data.stone_why: Future's Market pairs incredibly well with Ornn's Passice allowing him to not only buy in lane, but also earlier than usual.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
You can enter debt to buy items. The amount you can borrow increases over time.

Debt limit: 150 + 5/min
Lending Fee: 50 gold per item
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Enter debt to buy items early.

secondary_data.stone_why: Biscuits now provides a lot of health and mana regen allowing you to stay in lane even longer and press your lead.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Biscuit Delivery: Gain a Total Biscuit of Everlasting will every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes.

Biscuits restore 15% of your missing health and mana and increase your mana cap by 40 mana permanently.

Champions without mana restore 20% missing energy instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Periodically gain a biscuit with strong Health/Mana regen.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Call-back to the original Kog'maw rework, Lethal Tempo is a wet dream for the on-hit nature of Kog's damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
1.5s after damaging a champion gain 30 - 80% Attack Speed (based on level) for 3s. Attacking a champion extends the effect to 6s.

Cooldown: 6s

Lethal Tempo allows you to temporarily exceed the attack speed limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tons of attack speed | Exceeds Attack Speed limit.

primary_data.stone_why: Kog is all about ending the enemy's lives and Triumph is your paycheck for doing so.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Legend: Alacrity is the go-to on pretty much every AD Carry, especially Kog who loves to auto as much as possible.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Kog'Maw is great at taking down huge tanks thanks to his [W] and Cut Down pushes that even further.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Deal 4% more damage to champions with 150 more max health than you, increasing to 10% at 2000 more max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tank killer

secondary_data.stone_why: Ghost Poro is a great option for any champion because it allows you to keep up steady vision.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Enter a brush to summon a poro after a brief channel. The poro will stay behind to give you vision until you summon a new one.

If an enemy enters a brush with a poro in it, they scare it away, putting this effect on a 3s cooldown.

Poro channel is interrupted if you enter combat with a champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Entering a brush leaves temporary vision behind.

secondary_data.stone_why: Ravenous Hunter isn't an obvious choice here, but it actually allows you to heal from the on-hit damage of your [W].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Healing: 2.5% + 2.5% per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Who’s next?
builds.description: Last game scaling and dueling split push.

primary_data.stone_why: As with all on-hit champions, Kayle makes great great use of the massive Attack Speed burst while her [E] is up.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
1.5s after damaging a champion gain 30 - 80% Attack Speed (based on level) for 3s. Attacking a champion extends the effect to 6s.

Cooldown: 6s

Lethal Tempo allows you to temporarily exceed the attack speed limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tons of attack speed | Exceeds Attack Speed limit.

primary_data.stone_why: Triumph is the best rune choice in this group. The healing on a kill lets you pop [R] when low and come out the other side healthy enough to keep fighting.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: More Attack Speed simple means more autos while [E] is up. Solid choice in all situations.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: End your enemies life as quickly as possible, especially squishies.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: More [R]s means more opportunities to duel and split push, especially heading into the late game when your Gathering Storm AP kicks in.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

secondary_data.stone_why: Kayle is already a champion that scales quite well into the late game. Gathering Storm propels her to a position where she is likely able to duel anyone and kill them while in [R].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 10 min. gain AP or AD, Adaptive.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD
20 min: + 24 AP or 14 AD
30 min: + 48 AP or 29 AD
40 min: + 80 AP or 48 AD
50 min: + 120 AP or 72 AD
60 min: + 168 AP or 101 AD
etc...
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Every 10 minutes gain stacking AP or AD.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. builds.title: From the Shadows
builds.description: Split push and map pressure with ult.

primary_data.stone_why: Shen naturally takes great advantage of Grasp's empowered auto-attacks thanks to the majority of his power being in his [Q].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 4s in combat, your next basic attack on a champion will:

  • Deal bonus damage equal to 4% of your max health
  • Heal you for 2% of your max health
  • Permanently increase your health by 5

Ranged Champions: Damage and healing are halved and gain 2 permanent health instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus damage / heal based on max health. Permanent max health.

primary_data.stone_why: This loadout focuses on split push pressure thanks to a lower cooldown [R]. Demolish excels in situations where you're able to split and take towers.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Charge up a powerful attack against a tower over 4s, when within 600 range of it. The charged attack deals 125 (+30% of your max health) bonus physical damage.

Cooldown: 45s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tower burst damage based on max health.

primary_data.stone_why: Conditioning is an all-around solid defensive rune, giving up early weak resists for stronger resists later. These resists also scale well with Shen's natural health stacking.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: Shen loves to stack health as it improves his passive shield and tankiness. Overgrowth scales incredibly well with high-health items and champions.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 8 monsters or enemy minions that die near you permanently increases your max health by 0.2%.

Range: 1400 units
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Minions that die nearby give max health.

secondary_data.stone_why: Transcendence + The Ultimate hat will go a long way in getting you to CDR cap and above so you're able to continue splitting an enter any fight with [R].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Shen's [R] has a naturally long cooldown so every percentage of CDR from The Ultimate hat has even more value.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

builds.title: Burn Away the Shadows
builds.description: Lane poke, pressure, and kill-threat. By: Aphromoo

primary_data.stone_why: Arcane Comet is a great rune choice on Lux because she is often able to land it for the bonus damage thanks to the snare from [Q] and slow from [E].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Band is a great option for Lux when you are looking to do a lot of poking in the early game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: Absolute Focus further empowers your ability to poke and deal massive damage from afar while staying at full health. The extra bit of AP will help you make those picks and one-shots.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: While above 70% health, gain an adaptive bonus of up to 24 Attack Damage or 40 Ability Power (based on level).
build_keystone.stone_short_description: When above 70% health, gain extra AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch's early game poke damage lets you set yourself up for level 6 kill threat and provide pressure during the laning phase.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Biscuit Delivery greats you reliable and strong sustain, especially in close all-in lane fights where the last minute healing can pay off big and help you survive.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Biscuit Delivery: Gain a Total Biscuit of Everlasting will every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes.

Biscuits restore 15% of your missing health and mana and increase your mana cap by 40 mana permanently.

Champions without mana restore 20% missing energy instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Periodically gain a biscuit with strong Health/Mana regen.

secondary_data.stone_why: Cosmic Insight's all-around CDR is nothing but good for Lux, providing extra damage and utility throughout the game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

build_keystone.stone_long_description: You get Slightly Magical Boots at 10 min, but you cannot buy boots before then. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.

+5% CDR
