builds.title: Can’t Milk Those
builds.description: Engage and teamfight power with item actives.

primary_data.stone_why: Aftershock, like Courage of the Colossus, is a great keystone choice for Alister as it gives you defenses upon engaging and a bit of extra damage thanks to the explosion.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Damage: 40-140 (+3.5% your maximum health)
Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: Font of Life is a solid rune choice for Alistar as both his  [W], [Q], and stun on [E] will proc the mark providing a lot of healing for your team if you're able to hit multiple enemies.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them for 4s.

Ally champions who attack marked enemies heal for 5 + 1% of your max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Allies heal when attacking enemies you impair | Think old Stoneborne Pact.

primary_data.stone_why: Icon Skin is a great rune choice for laning as the bonus Armor lets you take efficient trades.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: Revitaltize is a suprisingly good rune choice here on Alistar. He gains bonus healing on his passive as well as Font of Life and his item actives (Lock/Redemption/Face of the Mountain).

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

secondary_data.stone_why: Supports ward more than any other position in the game and Zombie ward scales quite well with the number of wards you place throughout the game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

secondary_data.stone_why: Because Alistar's item choices often include huge actives like Locket and Face of the Mountain, Ingenious Hunter + Ruby Sightstone gives you insane uptime on those big teamfight winning items.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% Active Item CDR plus an additional 6% per Bounty Hunter stack (includes Trinkets).

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Item & Trinket CDR stacks from unique kills / assists.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Ryze's natural spell-spam nature allows you to easily proc Phase Rush with [W]->[E]->[Q] and stick to your target for follow-up damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting an enemy champion with 3 attacks or separate abilities within 3s grants 10 - 40% Movement Speed based on level.

Duration: 3s
Cooldown: 15s
Additionally, gain 75% Slow Resistance or the duration.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks or abilities grants speed boost | Think old Stormraider's.

primary_data.stone_why: Ryze naturally stacks mana with Tear and RoA so you gets extra mana returned allowing you to spam a lot more spell in the mid-game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: Transcendence allows you 10% CDR earlier in the game than you might otherwise have access to because you're rushing mana stacking items.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Gathering Storm is a great late-game insurance policy that scales incredibly well the longer the game goes on, allow you to deal insane damage at 40mins+.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 10 min. gain AP or AD, Adaptive.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD
20 min: + 24 AP or 14 AD
30 min: + 48 AP or 29 AD
40 min: + 80 AP or 48 AD
50 min: + 120 AP or 72 AD
60 min: + 168 AP or 101 AD
etc...
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Every 10 minutes gain stacking AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Paired with Cosmic Insight, your mid-game skirmish potential will be incredibly strong having a great mix of AP, Health, Mana, and CDR. Cosmic Insight is also great on mid-laners who take Teleport for the shorter cooldown.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

secondary_data.stone_why: Perfect Timing allows for a cheaper and faster Zhonya's to pull of the clutch Paladin combos (Zhonya's + [R]).

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Stack the Bodies Higher
builds.description: Lane phase poke and harassment with Comet.

primary_data.stone_why: Arcane Comet on Sion in an incredibly reliable source of damage thanks to his natural slows on [Q] and [E]. In the laning phase, paired with Scorch, Comet provides fantastic lane pressure damage when maxing [E] first.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Band is your means to mana sustain in the laning phase so that your capable of continuously harassing with [E] and comet.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: Transcendence is a great rune choice on tanks who are looking to stack a lot of big CDR items and can still benefit massivly from the extra bit of AD or AP after capping.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch is your go-to lane harassment rune. Combined with [E] max and Comet you'll be able to safely harass from a distance when passing [E] through minions.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Iron Skin is a great rune to help you sustain and out-trade during the laning phase. The extra bit of early Armor can also pay off big when trying to turn a jungle gank.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

secondary_data.stone_why: Second Wind paired with Iron Skin allows you to take a number of early trades and come out with a health lead.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +130 Health

patch.title: Patch 7.24
patch.description: Patch 7.24 is the first major balance pass at the new rune system and touches a number of of runes throughout including buffs to Fleet Feetwork and Phase Rush, nerfs to Press the Attack and Triumph and many more.

builds.title: Death Had Its Chance
builds.description: Massive health stacking and tower smashing.

primary_data.stone_why: Sion's natural % health stacking on [W] synergizes with the oh-hit health stacking on Grasp letting him hit massive health numbers in the late-game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 4s in combat, your next basic attack on a champion will:

  • Deal bonus damage equal to 4% of your max health
  • Heal you for 2% of your max health
  • Permanently increase your health by 5

Ranged Champions: Damage and healing are halved and gain 2 permanent health instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus damage / heal based on max health. Permanent max health.

primary_data.stone_why: With Demolish we can convert the massive health stackng on [W], Grasp, and Overgrowth to big-time tower damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Charge up a powerful attack against a tower over 4s, when within 600 range of it. The charged attack deals 125 (+30% of your max health) bonus physical damage.

Cooldown: 45s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tower burst damage based on max health.

primary_data.stone_why: The Armor and Magic Resist you gain from Conditioning are even more effective because you are stacking so heavily on health.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: Overgrowth + Sion's [W] passive lets you hit insane health number in the late game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 8 monsters or enemy minions that die near you permanently increases your max health by 0.2%.

Range: 1400 units
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Minions that die nearby give max health.

secondary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Ban's massive mana sustain allows you to use your large health pool to widdle away at your opponent's health bar in lane and out-sustian them.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

secondary_data.stone_why: Scorch's extra bit of lane harass damage allows you to take a lot of trades in the laning phase with long-range [E]'s and come out ahead of your opponent.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.24
patch.description: Patch 7.24 is the first major balance pass at the new rune system and touches a number of of runes throughout including buffs to Fleet Feetwork and Phase Rush, nerfs to Press the Attack and Triumph and many more.

builds.title: Life’s Cheap, Death Pays
builds.description: Heavy sustain, life steal, and safety.

primary_data.stone_why: Fleet Footwork is a great AD Carry keystone for champions who can be abused by their short range, allowing them to sustain reliably into the late game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Attacking a moving builds Energy stacks. At 100 stacks, your next attack is Energized.

Energized attacks heal you for 3 - 60 (+0.30 bonus AD, +0.40 AP) and grant 30% increased Movement Speed for 1s.

Healing is 60% as effective when used on a minion.
If the attack that activates Fleet Footwork is a critical hit, Fleet Footwork's healing is increased by 40% of your critical damage modifier
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Lane sustain | Engage Movement. Think old Warlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Overheal synergizes well with Fleet Footwork, Bloodline, and Taste of Blood, keeping to topped off in lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Excess healing on you becomes a shield, for up to 10% of your total health + 10.

Shield is built up from 40% of excess healing from self, or 300% of excess healing from allies.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Excess incoming heals become a shield (includes lifesteal etc.)

primary_data.stone_why: The Life Steal from Bloodline in the late game is incredibly strong on Sivir with her heavy Crit stacking.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 0.8% life steal for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Life Steal stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Cut Down is great for chopping down tanks, melee supports, and mid laners who might build Rylais and/or Liandries.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Deal 4% more damage to champions with 150 more max health than you, increasing to 10% at 2000 more max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tank killer

secondary_data.stone_why: With the bounce from [W], Sivir can easily proc the heal from taste of Blood without even trying to hit the enemy champions, allowing you to sustain in lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal when you damage an enemy champion.

Healing: 18 - 35 (+0.20 bonus AD, +0.1 AP) health (based on level).

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Heal when you damage champions.

secondary_data.stone_why: Zombie Ward is a great rune for lane safety vision, especially placing trinket wards in the tri-brush where they may not be cleared for a while.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Summon Aery is a great option for Soraka both offensively (with autos and [Q]) and defensively (with [W]).

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging enemies or shielding allies.

Damage: 15 - 40 based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD)
Shield: 30 - 80 based on level (+0.25 AP and +0.4 bonus AD)

Aery cannot be sent out to again until she returns to you.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks/abilities summon Aery to damage enemies / shield allies.

primary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Band is a great option here for Soraka because you're going to want to  play aggressively in lane early spamming [Q].

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: Celerity on Soraka allows you to position yourself safely in teamfights and skirmishes so that you're able to continue pumping out heals.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch allows you to dominate the lane phase if you're able to consistently land your [Q].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Because you're going to be healing so much over the course of the game, Revitalize gets fantastic value, especially if the target is low health.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

secondary_data.stone_why: Font of Life doesn't seem like an obvious choice but if you can land your [Q] regularly it synergies well with your itemization and Revitalize.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them for 4s.

Ally champions who attack marked enemies heal for 5 + 1% of your max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Allies heal when attacking enemies you impair | Think old Stoneborne Pact.

rune_secondary.rune_description: +130 Health

patch.description: Patch 7.24 is the first major balance pass at the new rune system and touches a number of of runes throughout including buffs to Fleet Feetwork and Phase Rush, nerfs to Press the Attack and Triumph and many more.

builds.title: That’s Gotta Sting
builds.description: Maximum lane pressure damage and harassment.

primary_data.stone_why: Summon Aery is fantastic lane dominance and annoyance rune on Teemo. With an Auto->[Q]->Auto you're able to double-proc Aery for really oppressive early game harass damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging enemies or shielding allies.

Damage: 15 - 40 based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD)
Shield: 30 - 80 based on level (+0.25 AP and +0.4 bonus AD)

Aery cannot be sent out to again until she returns to you.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks/abilities summon Aery to damage enemies / shield allies.

primary_data.stone_why: The Ultimate Hat allows you to further press your role as an "annoying little s***" by keeping tons of mushrooms up at all time all around the map and keep yourself safe from ganks in lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

primary_data.stone_why: Celerity synergizes well with Teemo's [W], granting a bit of extra AP while your Movement Speed steroid is active.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch is the go-to lane harass/pressure rune and is a must have on Teemo if you're looking to get the most out of your laning phase.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Alacrity on Teemo is another great lane pressure rune as the extra Attack Speed will help you get more autos off for poison damage and Aery procs.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

secondary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace help you scale into the mid to late game. The extra bit of damage means if in unsuspecting enemy support accidentally walks into a mushroom when they are below 40% health they are likely to die.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Glacial Augment acts as a replacement to Frozen Mallet allowing you to abuse your range in lane and build into more offensive items. By building BotRK you also gain an additional AoE slow.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Basic attacking a champion slows them for 2s. The slow increases in strength over its duration.

  • Ranged attacks slow by up to 20%-40%
  • Melee attacks slow by up to 40%-50%

Slowing a champion with active items shoots a freeze ray through them, freezing the nearby ground for 5s, slowing all units inside by 50%

Cooldown: 7-4s second per-unit cooldown
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Slow enemies on hit. Active slows cast AoE slow.

primary_data.stone_why: Biscuits are a great means of sustain allowing you to save money on potions and invest it into you damage items to further push a lead.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Biscuit Delivery: Gain a Total Biscuit of Everlasting will every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes.

Biscuits restore 15% of your missing health and mana and increase your mana cap by 40 mana permanently.

Champions without mana restore 20% missing energy instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Periodically gain a biscuit with strong Health/Mana regen.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
You can enter debt to buy items. The amount you can borrow increases over time.

Debt limit: 150 + 5/min
Lending Fee: 50 gold per item
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Enter debt to buy items early.

primary_data.stone_why: Approach Velocity synergizes extremely well with Glacial Augment and Teemo's [R] allowing you to chase any enemy to their death.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% Movement Speed towards nearby allies that are movement impaired or enemies that you impair.

Range: 1000
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Movement speed towards impaired allies / enemies.

secondary_data.stone_why: The beauty of Absolute Focus on Teemo is that you're often dealing damage to champions when you are full health and even in base, thanks to any mushrooms you have spread across the map. Teemo is likely one of the biggest abusers of the Absolute Focus rune.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: While above 70% health, gain an adaptive bonus of up to 24 Attack Damage or 40 Ability Power (based on level).
build_keystone.stone_short_description: When above 70% health, gain extra AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Scorch is a fantastic rune for abusing and poking in lane. Teemo can easily proc this une on cooldown thanks to the long range of his [Q].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive

builds.title: Here Comes the Boom
builds.description: Snowballing ganks and massive burst. From Afreeca Freecs Spirit

primary_data.stone_why: Press the Attack pairs well with Tristana's [E], exposing the enemy after 3 auto attacks empowering her bomb explosion for massive burst.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 consecutive basic attacks will deal 30 - 120 bonus adaptive damage (based on level) and makes them vulnerable, increasing the damage they take by 12% from all sources for 6s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Triumph allows Trist to massively heal after every kill so she can reset her [W] and and jump to the next enemy champion to keep fighting.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: More Attack Speed means a faster and healthier jungle clear as well as a faster [E]/Press the Attack stack on ganks.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Tristana jungle is all about jumping onto squishy targets and blowing them up so she can jump again. Coup De Grace helps you kill those squishies extra fast.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Absolute Focus' bonus AD when coming out of the jungle for a gank provides you with massive burst for a quick kill and reset on [W].

build_keystone.stone_long_description: While above 70% health, gain an adaptive bonus of up to 24 Attack Damage or 40 Ability Power (based on level).
build_keystone.stone_short_description: When above 70% health, gain extra AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Waterwalking allows you to take quick and early scuttle control thanks to your massive AD stacking early with Absolute Focus and Waterwalking.

builds.title: Super Rapid Fire
builds.description: Maximum Attack Speed with Rapid Fire.

primary_data.stone_why: Attack Speed is the name of the game with Tristana and Lethal Tempo allows you to really embrace that. Pair it with her [Q] and you'll be reaching incredibly high attack speed numbers early.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
1.5s after damaging a champion gain 30 - 80% Attack Speed (based on level) for 3s. Attacking a champion extends the effect to 6s.

Cooldown: 6s

Lethal Tempo allows you to temporarily exceed the attack speed limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tons of attack speed | Exceeds Attack Speed limit.

primary_data.stone_why: Triumph is Dangerous Game on steroids, allowing you to push your limits in fights and reset, Rocket Jump in, and continue fighting healthily. Oh and bonus kill gold is nice too.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Tristana is a heavily auto attack focused Marksman so more Attack Speed is always welcome.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Tristana really wants to finish off her target ASAP so she is able to get the cooldown reset on her [W] and continue fighting or jump to safety. Coup De Grace help in that department.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Because this Loadout features a lot of easy ways of getting Attack Speed, your build is open for an earlier Guardian Angel and Perfect timing effectively gives you free gold toward the item.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

secondary_data.stone_why: Magical footwear is a great choice on any champion Loadout as it can be seen as simply earning 350g at level 10, which is always good (assuming you don't like to rush early boots).

build_keystone.stone_long_description: You get Slightly Magical Boots at 10 min, but you cannot buy boots before then. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free boots at 10 minutes.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

builds.title: Primal Domination
builds.description: Great mix of damage and tankiness.

primary_data.stone_why: Press the Attack is a great replacement to Fervor for Warwack as he's able to easily proc it with an auto + [Q] + auto or [R].

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 consecutive basic attacks will deal 30 - 120 bonus adaptive damage (based on level) and makes them vulnerable, increasing the damage they take by 12% from all sources for 6s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Combined with the heal from your [Q] Overheal provides a stable shield to keep you healthy entering into fights from the jungle.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Excess healing on you becomes a shield, for up to 10% of your total health + 10.

Shield is built up from 40% of excess healing from self, or 300% of excess healing from allies.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Excess incoming heals become a shield (includes lifesteal etc.)

primary_data.stone_why: As an immobile melee champion you're subject to a lot of CC. The tenacity from his rune will help you stick to your targets.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 5% tenacity plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Because Warwick naturally heals and builds health he gets the most damage value from Coup De Grace.

Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Unflinching is a rune that synergizes well with most Junglers as smite casts will grant you the Tenacity and Slow resist buff when sprinting in for a gank.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance by 10% for each Summoner Spell on cooldown. After casting a Summoner Spell, gain 15% additional Tenacity and Slow Resistance for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

secondary_data.stone_why: More Armor and Magic Resist is strong and is multiplicative with the extra shielding and healing from Overheal and Font of Life.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

builds.description: Maximum damage output and dueling power.

primary_data.stone_why: Press the Attack synergizes well with Kled's [W], allowing you to use the first 3 auto attack to proc the exposure and the 4th empower auto to hit extra hard.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 consecutive basic attacks will deal 30 - 120 bonus adaptive damage (based on level) and makes them vulnerable, increasing the damage they take by 12% from all sources for 6s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Triumph is an all-around valuable rune for staying alive in teamfight. It allows you to dive for a kill, take a lot of damage, and continue fighting thanks to the heal.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Kled's entire kit is designed around empowering his ability to land more auto attacks. The more autos you can get off in a fight directly relates to how much damage you're doing.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace is a fantastic default damage rune in this slot that allows you to finish of low health targets much more reliably.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Kled makes great use of Sudden Impact's Lethality thanks to his ability to dash twice with [E]. If you hit your target with [E] and stagger the reactivation you can keep the Lethality buff active on yourself for 10s+.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

secondary_data.stone_why: The primary purpose for Ingenious Hunter on Kled is to massively increase up-time of Titanic Hydra. With max stacks, Titanic Hydra is on a 12s cooldown, allowing you to use it multiple times in a fight.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% Active Item CDR plus an additional 6% per Bounty Hunter stack (includes Trinkets).

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Item & Trinket CDR stacks from unique kills / assists.

builds.title: Off to the Races
builds.description: Maximum Movement Speed stacking and dive.

primary_data.stone_why: Predator's active Movement Speed buff synergizes incredibly well with Hecarim's [E] and passive when looking to sprint into a lane for a gank.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Enchants your boots with the active effect 'Predator.'

Channel for 1.5s out of combat to gain 45% Movement Speed for 15s. Damaging attacks or abilities end this effect, dealing 60 - 140 (+0.4 bonus AD)(+0.25 AP) bonus adaptive damage.

Cooldown: 150 - 100s. Starts the game on cooldown and goes on cooldown if interrupted while channeling.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Movement speed active on boots | Increased engage damage.

primary_data.stone_why: Hecarim can proc Sudden Impact upon landing [E] or dashing with [R]. The bonus Lethalty allows you to assassinate squishies as you dive the backline.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: Zombie Ward is a safe a reliable rune on every Jungle thanks to the nature of their vision control and ability to deep ward.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

primary_data.stone_why: Relentless Hunter's Movement Speed grants you the freedom to quickly get to any fight or lane and synergizes well with Predator, Celerity, and Waterwalking.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Movement Speed means damage for Hecarim and Celerity doubles-down on that, empowering your passive, Predator, and Waterwalking.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: The bonus Movement Speed granted while in the river double dips with Celerity and Hecarim's passive, allowing him to freely take early dragon and duel just about anyone.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 25 Movement Speed and an adaptive bonus of up to 18 Attack Damage or 30 Ability Power (based on level) when in the river.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain MS and AP or AD, when in the river.

primary_data.stone_why: Due to his natural reset nature, Kha'Zix makes great use of Dark Harvest's perpetual damage increase upon killing enemy champions.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Champions, large minions, and large monsters drop soul essence on death. Collecting a soul to become Soul Charged. Your next attack on a champion or structure consumes Soul Charged to deal bonus adaptive damage.

Soul Charged lasts 20s, increased to 300s after collecting 150 soul essence.

Bonus damage: 40 - 80 (+0.25 bonus AD) (+0.2 AP) + soul essence collected.

Champion souls - 6 soul essence.
Monster souls - 2 soul essence.
Minion souls - 4 soul essence.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Nearby dying large minions / monsters / champions grants burst damage.

primary_data.stone_why: Through the use of his [R] and [E] Kha'Zix is able to keep Sudden Impact's Lethality buff for the entirety of almost all fights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: Kill wards, kills champion, gain damage. Kha loves to check all of those boxes so Eyeball Collection is a no-brainer.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain an adaptive bonus of 0.6 Attack Damage or 1 Ability Power, per eyeball collected.

Upon completing your collection at 20 eyeballs, gain an adaptive bonus of 6 Attack Damage, or 10 Ability Power.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Ingenious Hunter provides an incredible amount of item CDR. A few early kills and you'll be clearing every ward with Duskblade and entering every lane with Ghostblade.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% Active Item CDR plus an additional 6% per Bounty Hunter stack (includes Trinkets).

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Item & Trinket CDR stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Execution on squishy targets is the name of the game for Kha'Zix so Coup De Grace adds the most damage for ending those target's lives ASAP.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Because you're naturally looking to kill ASAP, reset, and jump to the next target you'll want to make sure you're healthy enough to move on and Triumph plays up on that by giving you a lot of health after each kill.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Annie loves to burst and blow up her enemies. A [R]->[Q]->[W] will proc Electrocute for massive damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Annie can reliably proc Cheap Shot thanks to her stun. Once you get *Rylai's you can continuously proc the true damage with Tibber's Aura**.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging champions with impaired movement or actions deals 12 - 30 bonus true damage (based on level).

Cooldown: 4s
Applies to damage occurring after the impairment.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus true damage to impaired (slowed etc.) champions.

primary_data.stone_why: Zombie Ward helps keep you safe in the early to mid game proving a lot of extra value for every trinket ward you place, especially in tri-brushes.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

primary_data.stone_why: The bonus Movement Speed empowers you to roam around the map with your stun up for ganks and flash-engages.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Annie is all about blowing up the enemy team with massive Tibbers ults. More [R]s also means more opportunities to take objectives with Tibbers tanking.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

secondary_data.stone_why: More CDR means more spell rotations. More spell rotations means more damage and kills.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

builds.title: Bring down the Guillotine

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Champions, large minions, and large monsters drop soul essence on death. Collecting a soul to become Soul Charged. Your next attack on a champion or structure consumes Soul Charged to deal bonus adaptive damage.

Soul Charged lasts 20s, increased to 300s after collecting 150 soul essence.

Bonus damage: 40 - 80 (+0.25 bonus AD) (+0.2 AP) + soul essence collected.

Champion souls - 6 soul essence.
Monster souls - 2 soul essence.
Minion souls - 4 soul essence.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Nearby dying large minions / monsters / champions grants burst damage.

primary_data.stone_why: A bit of extra true damage is just what Darius wants in this build, being all about kills and snowballing. [W], Deadman's Plate, and Righteous Glory all contribute to you doing more True Damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging champions with impaired movement or actions deals 12 - 30 bonus true damage (based on level).

Cooldown: 4s
Applies to damage occurring after the impairment.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus true damage to impaired (slowed etc.) champions.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Healing: 2.5% + 2.5% per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Darius tends to heal quite a bit through the combination of his [Q] and Spirit Visage and Revitalize empowers that, especially in fights where you run low on health.

Channel for 1.5s out of combat to gain 45% Movement Speed for 15s. Damaging attacks or abilities end this effect, dealing 60 - 140 (+0.4 bonus AD)(+0.25 AP) bonus adaptive damage.

Cooldown: 150 - 100s. Starts the game on cooldown and goes on cooldown if interrupted while channeling.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Movement speed active on boots | Increased engage damage.

primary_data.stone_why: Cheap Shot allows your to repeatedly deal True Damage to whatever target your attacking thanks to the perma-slow from [Q] and Righteous Glory.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging champions with impaired movement or actions deals 12 - 30 bonus true damage (based on level).

Cooldown: 4s
Applies to damage occurring after the impairment.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus true damage to impaired (slowed etc.) champions.

primary_data.stone_why: Eyeball Collection allows you to snowball those successful ganks into more kills and a massive lead.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain an adaptive bonus of 0.6 Attack Damage or 1 Ability Power, per eyeball collected.

Upon completing your collection at 20 eyeballs, gain an adaptive bonus of 6 Attack Damage, or 10 Ability Power.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: The item CDR from Ingenious Hunter allows you way more uses of Predator and Righteous Glory for those unstoppable ganks.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% Active Item CDR plus an additional 6% per Bounty Hunter stack (includes Trinkets).

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Item & Trinket CDR stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Triumph on Olaf allows you to dive into the back line, absorb the brunt of the damage for your team, and heal for a ton from any kills or assists to keep fighting.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace is the go-to tune for reliable damage in fights where you're able to get to the back-line and shred the enemy squishy champions.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

rune_main.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Time to Start Some Trouble
builds.description: Target acquisition, chasing, and spell vamp healing.

primary_data.stone_why: Glacial Augment on on Ekko allows you to [E] in onto the enemy champion and almost guarantee a hit with both parts of your [Q] thanks to the slow.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Basic attacking a champion slows them for 2s. The slow increases in strength over its duration.

  • Ranged attacks slow by up to 20%-40%
  • Melee attacks slow by up to 40%-50%

Slowing a champion with active items shoots a freeze ray through them, freezing the nearby ground for 5s, slowing all units inside by 50%

Cooldown: 7-4s second per-unit cooldown
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Slow enemies on hit. Active slows cast AoE slow.

primary_data.stone_why: Zhonya's is a core item on Ekko as it allows you to throw down [W] on yourself and hit the stasis to extra safety.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

primary_data.stone_why: Minion Dematerializer on Ekko help you wave-clear in the mid game so you're able to keep lane priority and match roam/fights in the jungle.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with 6 Minion Dematerializers that kill and absorb lane minions instantly. Minion Dematerializers are on cooldown for the first 155s of the game.

Absorbing a minion increases your damage by +4% against that type of minion permanently, and an extra +1% for each additional minion of that type absorbed.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kill 6 minions for free and gain bonus minion damage.

primary_data.stone_why: More CDR means more spell casts, healing, and Ekko makes great use of the item CDR thanks to your build of Gunblade, Zhonya's, and Protobelt.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

secondary_data.stone_why: Ekko is a fantastic user of Sudden Impact for the bonus Magic Penetration after hitting an enemy with [E]. The extra bit of damage can be the difference between a kill and the enemy surviving.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

secondary_data.stone_why: Ravenous Hunter empowers your ability to trade and sustain in lane thanks to the massive healing from your [Q] and passive.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Healing: 2.5% + 2.5% per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

rune_main.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.24
patch.description: Patch 7.24 is the first major balance pass at the new rune system and touches a number of of runes throughout including buffs to Fleet Feetwork and Phase Rush, nerfs to Press the Attack and Triumph and many more.

primary_data.stone_why: Ekko can easily proc Electrocute with [Q] and [E], allowing him to burst down his opponent before they know what hit him.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: After casting [E] Ekko gains both Magic Penetration and Lethality making his assassination potential incredibly high.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: Zombie Ward allows you to keep wards up around mid-lane and provide even more safety in the laning phase.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

primary_data.stone_why: Like LeBlanc, Ekko massively benefits from Spell Vamp on his passive damage allowing him to sustain in lane and pressure his opponent.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Healing: 2.5% + 2.5% per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: More [R]s means a lot more safety for all-ins, dives, and escaping ganks.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

secondary_data.stone_why: Like most mid-lane mages, Ekkos loves as much CDR as he can get his hands on.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

rune_main.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Aftershock is the successor to Courage of the Colossus, but rather than granting a shield it does damage and give a ton of Armor and Magic Resist. Galio loves Magic Resist

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Damage: 40-140 (+3.5% your maximum health)
Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: One of Galio's biggest weaknesses is his lack of mobility and CC can punish him hard (especially being melee). The bonus tenacity and slow resist from Perseverance will help you get to your targets and escape.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance by 10% for each Summoner Spell on cooldown. After casting a Summoner Spell, gain 15% additional Tenacity and Slow Resistance for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

primary_data.stone_why: Galio loves Magic Resist for both offense and defense. Mirror shell gives you some early MR and further helps your MR scale into the late game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 6 Magic Resist. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Magic Resist by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 MR | Healing increase MR temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: Paired with with early resists and health, Second wind provides excellent lane sustain and trading power.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

secondary_data.stone_why: Galio's abilities have relative high mana costs and be needs to spam to keep up with wave pushes. Manaflow Band will give you the needed mana sustain to shove and roam.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

secondary_data.stone_why: Entering the mid-game, Multiple successful taunts from [W] will make or break your teamfights and CDR is what enables that.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

primary_data.stone_why: Locking a gold or red card with [W] effectively guarantees a hit with Comet making it one of the most reliable uses of the rune of any champion.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: TF's map pressure from his ultimate is what makes his entire kit so strong for solo queue games. Having your [R] up more often means more pressure.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

primary_data.stone_why: Celereity grants you the movement speed needed to roam and land gold cards and while also giving you a little bit of extra AP from Ghost/Lich Bane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Gathering Storm is just an all-around great rune for late-game damage insurance.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 10 min. gain AP or AD, Adaptive.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD
20 min: + 24 AP or 14 AD
30 min: + 48 AP or 29 AD
40 min: + 80 AP or 48 AD
50 min: + 120 AP or 72 AD
60 min: + 168 AP or 101 AD
etc...
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Every 10 minutes gain stacking AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Movement Speed is a highly prized stat for TF. It lets him get back to lane faster and pressure the map on both sides with [R].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Zombie Ward helps keep you safe in the early to mid game proving a lot of extra value for every trinket ward you place, especially when warding the sides of mid.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

primary_data.stone_why: With the use of his [W] Jayce is easily able to quickly proc the bonus damage and empower the rest of his combo.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 consecutive basic attacks will deal 30 - 120 bonus adaptive damage (based on level) and makes them vulnerable, increasing the damage they take by 12% from all sources for 6s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: The combination of Presence of Mind and Manaflow Band relieve you of having to delay your damage by purchasing a tear for Mana sustain.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: For 7s after gaining a level or takedown the mana you spend on abilities is fully restored.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Level ups / Kills / Assists give free mana for 5 seconds.

primary_data.stone_why: Jayce's biggest weakness is Crowd Control. Legend: Tenacity paired with Mercury Treads means you should be able to escape most ganks with relative safety.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 5% tenacity plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Jayce excels in matchups into tanks where he can abuse his ranged kit. Cut Down brings some extra damage to kill those tanks.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Deal 4% more damage to champions with 150 more max health than you, increasing to 10% at 2000 more max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tank killer

secondary_data.stone_why: As a form-swapping champion, Jayce's damage comes from repeated casts of his abilities so CDR is a must have.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Combined with Presence of Mind, you should have little issues with mana sustain while still being able to harass your opponent with abilities.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Triumph allows Xin to jump in a fight, kill his target with the laners, and move onto the next target or continue jungling healthily.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Xin's biggest counter is CC that locks him up upon jumping into a fight with [E]. The bonus Tenacity here lets you continue to pump out damage ASAP.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 5% tenacity plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.

primary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace synergizes incredibly well with Press the Attack when looking to [E] onto an enemy carry early in the game, and end their life.

Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Unflinching synergizes well with Junglers as their constantly casting smite for a more frequent proc of this rune.

build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

secondary_data.stone_why: Second Wind is a great rune for sustaining during fights, and because Xin has no way out after going in, he needs to stay alive as long as possible.

primary_data.stone_why: Arcane Comet is a relatively abusable keystone for Lissandra thanks to the very short cooldown and slow on [Q]. [Q] harass with Comet and Scorch will result in a lot of chip damage during lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: The Ultimate Hat grants Lissandra fantastic safety and kill pressure. At 45% CDR and max Hat stacks, your ult is down to 32s.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

primary_data.stone_why: Absolute Focus empowers your ability to harass in lane with long range [Q]s through the minion wave for even more empowered damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: While above 70% health, gain an adaptive bonus of up to 24 Attack Damage or 40 Ability Power (based on level).
build_keystone.stone_short_description: When above 70% health, gain extra AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch is a fantastic lane harass rune, and pairs incredibly well with Aery to keep the pressure up.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Biscuit Delivery is a great rune in match-ups where you're intending to sustain in lane for larger back timings. If timed well (when low health) in fights, the massive sustain can be the difference between life and death.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Biscuit Delivery: Gain a Total Biscuit of Everlasting will every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes.

Biscuits restore 15% of your missing health and mana and increase your mana cap by 40 mana permanently.

Champions without mana restore 20% missing energy instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Periodically gain a biscuit with strong Health/Mana regen.

secondary_data.stone_why: Future's Market on Lissandra allows you to hit an earlier Rod of Ages purchase to begin stacking sooner than normal, making your mid game incredibly strong if you're not behind..

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
You can enter debt to buy items. The amount you can borrow increases over time.

Debt limit: 150 + 5/min
Lending Fee: 50 gold per item
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Enter debt to buy items early.

patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Echoing from the Depths
builds.description: Burst damage and meat grinder execution.

primary_data.stone_why: Urgot is a fantastic user of Press the Attack because he is able to almost instantly proc the exposure damage with [W], allowing the rest of his follow-up damage to shred his target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 consecutive basic attacks will deal 30 - 120 bonus adaptive damage (based on level) and makes them vulnerable, increasing the damage they take by 12% from all sources for 6s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Urgot is a great lane duelist and Triumph allows you to potentially take a 1v2 against the enemy Jungler, executing the low target with [R], and moving on the kill the other.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Hard CC is Urgot's biggest proponent holding him back from killing everyone and every thing. More Tenacity will allow you to stick to your target and execute them.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 5% tenacity plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace is a rune designed to execute, allowing you to quickly get into execution range of your [R].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: The bonus Movement Speed of Celerity massively empowers your ability to dance around your target during [W] and proc every leg.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: More [R]s means more opportunity to snowball a lead and execute targets on cooldown.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: LeBlanc makes great use of Sudden Impact, gaining bonus Magic Pen and Lethality when entering a trade/fight with [W].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: LeBlanc is all about kills and snowballing. Eyeball Collection is a rune that further pushes your gains for every kill/assist.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain an adaptive bonus of 0.6 Attack Damage or 1 Ability Power, per eyeball collected.

Upon completing your collection at 20 eyeballs, gain an adaptive bonus of 6 Attack Damage, or 10 Ability Power.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: LeBlanc makes great use of Spell Vamp: Gunblade + Ravenous Hunter means you'll be healing for insane amounts int eh mid to late game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Healing: 2.5% + 2.5% per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Transcendence makes up for having to forgo early CDR in favor of Gunblade, making your mid-game incredibly deadly in skirmishes.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: More [R]s means more poke, more all-ins, and more kills. LeBlanc's low cooldown on [R] allows her to full stack Ult Hat very early in the game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.
