builds.title: The Clot Thickens
builds.description: Summoner Spell spam and mid game power-spike.

primary_data.stone_why: Unsealed Spellbook paired with boots of Lucidity and Cosmic Insight will grant you massive Summoner Cooldown allowing you to spam them for maximum kill potential and safety.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain a Summoner Shard at 2 minutes and another every 6 min after (max 2 shards).

While near the shop, you can exchange 1 Summoner Shard to replace a Summoner Spell with a different one.

Additionally, your Summoner Spell cooldowns are reduced by 25%.

Smite: Buying Smite won't grant access to Smite items
You cannot have two of the same Summoner Spell
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Swap summoner spells in game. 25% Summoner CDR.

primary_data.stone_why: The stasis from Stopwatch is a must have on Vlad as you're able to heal through it with your ultimate giving you the opportunity to potentially out-play the enemy in a 1v2 gank from the jungler.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

primary_data.stone_why: Magical Footwear saves you the hassle of having to spend that gold on boots, empowering your mid game for more damage/utility making you a monster.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: You get Slightly Magical Boots at 10 min, but you cannot buy boots before then. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free boots at 10 minutes.

primary_data.stone_why: Vladimir can massively abuse the extra bit of Summoner and spell CDR for harassment and lane pressure throughout the entire game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

secondary_data.stone_why: Transcendence on Vlad allows you to become an unkillable god in the mid-game, reaching 40% CDR with just Protobelt, Zhonya's, and Boots of Lucidity.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Scorch is a fantastic lane phase choice for Vlad for harassing with [Q]. The extra bit of damage allows you to keep the pressure up and put your enemy in kill potential range.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

patch.description: Patch 7.24 is the first major balance pass at the new rune system and touches a number of of runes throughout including buffs to Fleet Feetwork and Phase Rush, nerfs to Press the Attack and Triumph and many more.

builds.title: Vessel of Destruction
builds.description: Efficient lane trading and empowered healing.

primary_data.stone_why: Phase Rush on Vladimir allows you to chase down and position for a second round of spell rotations. Vlad can be easily kited and Phase Rush helps mitigate that.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting an enemy champion with 3 attacks or separate abilities within 3s grants 10 - 40% Movement Speed based on level.

Duration: 3s
Cooldown: 15s
Additionally, gain 75% Slow Resistance or the duration.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks or abilities grants speed boost | Think old Stormraider's.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch is a great lane presence rune that scales down as the game goes on. Combined with Taste of Blood, you can take very efficient trades in lane with [Q].

build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Taste of Blood on Vlad allows you further pressure your lane opponent through attrition of health.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Excess healing on you becomes a shield, for up to 10% of your total health + 10.

Shield is built up from 40% of excess healing from self, or 300% of excess healing from allies.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Excess incoming heals become a shield (includes lifesteal etc.)

primary_data.stone_why: Legend: Alacrity is the go-to on pretty much every AD Carry, especially Ashe who loves to auto as much as possible.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace pairs so well with Press the Attack's bonus damage and is more reliable than Last Stand when you have healing.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Of all AD Carries Ashe can abuse Cheap Shot more than any other. Her auto-attacks alone keep them slowed for free true damage on cooldown.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging champions with impaired movement or actions deals 12 - 30 bonus true damage (based on level).

Cooldown: 4s
Applies to damage occurring after the impairment.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus true damage to impaired (slowed etc.) champions.

secondary_data.stone_why: Ghost Poro is an excellent way to provide reliable vision to keep yourself safe during the laning phase.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Enter a brush to summon a poro after a brief channel. The poro will stay behind to give you vision until you summon a new one.

If an enemy enters a brush with a poro in it, they scare it away, putting this effect on a 3s cooldown.

Poro channel is interrupted if you enter combat with a champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Entering a brush leaves temporary vision behind.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Lethal Tempo on Tryndamere allows you to get an insane amount of Auto Attacks in during trades, all-ins, and during your [R]. In the mid to late game your Attack Speed gets so high that you become an incredibly scary threat to the backline.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
1.5s after damaging a champion gain 30 - 80% Attack Speed (based on level) for 3s. Attacking a champion extends the effect to 6s.

Cooldown: 6s

Lethal Tempo allows you to temporarily exceed the attack speed limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tons of attack speed | Exceeds Attack Speed limit.

primary_data.stone_why: Overheal synergizes well with Tryndamere's constant self healing from [Q] and BotRK allowing you to enter trades/fights with the early health advantage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Excess healing on you becomes a shield, for up to 10% of your total health + 10.

Shield is built up from 40% of excess healing from self, or 300% of excess healing from allies.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Excess incoming heals become a shield (includes lifesteal etc.)

primary_data.stone_why: More Attack Speed means more raw damage, kill threat, and split-pushing tower potential.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Last Stand is the perfect damage rune for Tryndamere synergizes insanely well with your[R]. As you pop [R] at low health you'll have a few seconds of being able to deal massive amounts of damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Deal 5 - 12% increased damage to champions while you are below 60% health, maximum damage gained at 30% health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra damage when low health.

secondary_data.stone_why: Sudden Impact synergizes well with Tryndamere's [Q] when looking to spin in for the all-in kill.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

secondary_data.stone_why: Ghost Poro provides fantastic on-demand lane safety when you're able to keep the enemy shoved in and keep the poro in the river brush uncontested.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Enter a brush to summon a poro after a brief channel. The poro will stay behind to give you vision until you summon a new one.

If an enemy enters a brush with a poro in it, they scare it away, putting this effect on a 3s cooldown.

Poro channel is interrupted if you enter combat with a champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Entering a brush leaves temporary vision behind.

primary_data.stone_why: Press the Attack synergizes well with BotRK and Jax's natural tendency to ramp damage in duels.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 consecutive basic attacks will deal 30 - 120 bonus adaptive damage (based on level) and makes them vulnerable, increasing the damage they take by 12% from all sources for 6s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Jax is a solid tower diver and Triumph's big heal can make the difference between life and deal in sticky situations.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Tenacity further empowers your ability to ramp your auto attacks with Press the Attack by allowing you to stick to your target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 5% tenacity plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Your rune choice here largely depends on if your laning against a tank or not. Coup De Grace is good at killing squishy champions.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: More Tenacity and slow resist means more opportunity to stick to your target, deal damage, and get the kill.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance by 10% for each Summoner Spell on cooldown. After casting a Summoner Spell, gain 15% additional Tenacity and Slow Resistance for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

secondary_data.stone_why: Second Wind is a good rune choice when looking to duel and trade as the in-combat sustain becomes incredibly useful.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +130 Health

patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: A successful Morgana [Q] results in a guaranteed landed Comet and a significant amount of damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Band is a great rune choice is this slot for Mage supports because to provides a significant amount of mana sustain for lane harass and skirmishes. If the enemy team has multiple AP threats you can take Nullifying Orb.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: Supports build a lot of CDR items thanks to the raw utility of their kits. More CDR = more power and with Transcendence you have no fear of over-capping. Celerity is a great secondary option for roams and picks.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: If you choose to put a point in [W] early Scorch becomes incredibly easy to proc on cooldown for lane harass.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: A free early Statis is a god-send for Morgana to land a huge [R]. The free Stopwatch also means that Zhonya's is that much closer to completion.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

secondary_data.stone_why: Doubling down on CDR and a little extra summoner cooldown for Flash->[R] is great here for Morg. Magical Footwear is also a great option here if you're looking to save money and hit combat stat power-spikes sooner.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive

builds.title: I’ve Seen Their Death
builds.description: Wave clear pressure, roams, and maximum utility.

primary_data.stone_why: The key to this build is lane pressure and roaming. Spellbook plus Cosmic Insight allows you to keep your Teleport on a short cooldown so you're able to shove lane and roam.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain a Summoner Shard at 2 minutes and another every 6 min after (max 2 shards).

While near the shop, you can exchange 1 Summoner Shard to replace a Summoner Spell with a different one.

Additionally, your Summoner Spell cooldowns are reduced by 25%.

Smite: Buying Smite won't grant access to Smite items
You cannot have two of the same Summoner Spell
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Swap summoner spells in game. 25% Summoner CDR.

primary_data.stone_why: Zhonya's and Zilean's [R] grant numerous chances to minimize positioning mistakes.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

primary_data.stone_why: Minion Dematerialzer plays a key role in being able to keep the lane pressure/wave clear up so you're able to leave lane and find ganks or fights with your jungler.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with 6 Minion Dematerializers that kill and absorb lane minions instantly. Minion Dematerializers are on cooldown for the first 155s of the game.

Absorbing a minion increases your damage by +4% against that type of minion permanently, and an extra +1% for each additional minion of that type absorbed.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kill 6 minions for free and gain bonus minion damage.

primary_data.stone_why: With Zilean's only damage ability being [Q], he heavily relies on the bonus CDR. The extra bit of Summoner CDR also means more TP pressure and Flash safety.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

secondary_data.stone_why: At level 16 Zilean's [R] is already pretty short. With max Ultimate Hat stacks that puts you at a 24s cooldown [R] heading into the mid game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

secondary_data.stone_why: Transcendence allows you to go Morello's and Lucidity as your only 2 CDR items, while still hitting cap.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: How About a Drink?
builds.description: Split-push, lane sustain, and summoner spell spam.

primary_data.stone_why: Singed's unique play-style allows him to excel in situations where he is able to cheese and split-push. Spellbook allows him to not only cheese for a kill by taking ignite, but also gives him the freedom to use his Summoner Spells more liberally thanks to the bonus Summoner CDR.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain a Summoner Shard at 2 minutes and another every 6 min after (max 2 shards).

While near the shop, you can exchange 1 Summoner Shard to replace a Summoner Spell with a different one.

Additionally, your Summoner Spell cooldowns are reduced by 25%.

Smite: Buying Smite won't grant access to Smite items
You cannot have two of the same Summoner Spell
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Swap summoner spells in game. 25% Summoner CDR.

primary_data.stone_why: Biscuit Delivery not only grants a massive amount Health regeneration but mana as well. Combined with the Inspiration's +20% potion bonus and Dark Seal, you can easily double the strength of all potions and Biscuits.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Biscuit Delivery: Gain a Total Biscuit of Everlasting will every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes.

Biscuits restore 15% of your missing health and mana and increase your mana cap by 40 mana permanently.

Champions without mana restore 20% missing energy instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Periodically gain a biscuit with strong Health/Mana regen.

primary_data.stone_why: Singed likes to run, and if you're able to effectively make it to the 10min mark without boots you'll be running even faster with the enhanced boots.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: You get Slightly Magical Boots at 10 min, but you cannot buy boots before then. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free boots at 10 minutes.

primary_data.stone_why: Celestial Body allows singed to endure a bit of harassment in the early-game so that he can get to the point of unstoppable split-pushing.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+100 Health permanently
-10% damage to champions and monsters until 10 mins.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +100 health | Less damage until 10 minutes.

secondary_data.stone_why: Unflinching synergizes incredibly well with both Spellbook's play-style of active Summoner use and granting Singed a large amount of Tenacity/Slow Resistance, his biggest counters.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance by 10% for each Summoner Spell on cooldown. After casting a Summoner Spell, gain 15% additional Tenacity and Slow Resistance for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

secondary_data.stone_why: Iron Skin allows you to take a small amount of less damage from minions while proxying. You're also able to easily proc the bonus Armor effect thanks to Biscuits and Refillable.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

rune_main.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +130 Health

primary_data.stone_why: Evelynn is able to easily proc Electrocute when coming out of stealth with a [W]->[Q]->[Q] combo for an extra burst of damage to finish her target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Exiting Stealth grants the Sudden Impact bonus Magic Penetration that Eve can use to assassinate the enemy champion.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: Clearing wards is a key part of a jungler's position. Pair that with assassination potential and you'll be racking of plenty of bonus Ability Power to snowball the game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain an adaptive bonus of 0.6 Attack Damage or 1 Ability Power, per eyeball collected.

Upon completing your collection at 20 eyeballs, gain an adaptive bonus of 6 Attack Damage, or 10 Ability Power.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Movement Speed is a key aspect to getting around the map to meet and initiate fights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Evelynn's [R] offers massive offensive power with it high base execution damage, and great defensive utility with it's ability to quickly blink you over a wall to get away.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

secondary_data.stone_why: The bonus Movement Speed from Celerity allows you to more quickly and effectively clear the jungle so you can properly position for ganks.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

rune_main.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

primary_data.stone_why: if you're able to open up with your [R] in a teamfight with Lethal Tempo you can take over an entire game.

1.5s after damaging a champion gain 30 - 80% Attack Speed (based on level) for 3s. Attacking a champion extends the effect to 6s.

Lethal Tempo allows you to temporarily exceed the attack speed limit.

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.

primary_data.stone_why: Cut Down is a great option on Twitch thanks to his ability to hit everyone on the enemy team who would build more health than an AD Carry.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Deal 4% more damage to champions with 150 more max health than you, increasing to 10% at 2000 more max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tank killer

If an enemy enters a brush with a poro in it, they scare it away, putting this effect on a 3s cooldown.

primary_data.stone_why: As a champion with a very assassin heavy play style, Diana loves the burst from Electrocute. She can proc the damage pre 6 with an [E]->[W]->auto thanks to the spells not having to do damage to count toward the proc.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Post 6 Sudden impact because a vital tool in blowing up enemy champions with all-ins.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: Zombie Ward is an overall very reliable and good rune in all situations. It's provides a ton of vision of the course of the game and helps keep you safe early.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

primary_data.stone_why: Relentless Hunter is a bit of a stylistic choice. As an assassin, Diana usually wants to type to roam a bit and find a target to explode.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Nullifying Orb is almost always a good mid lane rune choice when playing against a burst mage like Syndra. Diana can sometimes struggle due to her melee nature and Null helps to keep you out of kill range.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Upon taking magic damage that would reduce Health below 30%, grants a shield that absorbs 40 - 120 magic damage based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD) for 4 seconds.

Cooldown: 60s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Grants a magic shield when taken to low health by magic damage.

secondary_data.stone_why: Scorch is a rune that heavily focuses early to mid game chip damage. If you're confident in your ability to land [Q] often is lane this can potentially put you in a great position to kill your lane opponent at 6.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

rune_main.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

builds.title: Gotta Go Fast
builds.description: Massive Movement Speed, roaming, and map pressure.

primary_data.stone_why: Predator on Quinn combined with the Movement Speed from her [R] makes her an incredibly scary threat across the entire map.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Enchants your boots with the active effect 'Predator.'

Channel for 1.5s out of combat to gain 45% Movement Speed for 15s. Damaging attacks or abilities end this effect, dealing 60 - 140 (+0.4 bonus AD)(+0.25 AP) bonus adaptive damage.

Cooldown: 150 - 100s. Starts the game on cooldown and goes on cooldown if interrupted while channeling.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Movement speed active on boots | Increased engage damage.

primary_data.stone_why: Quinn can make great use of the bonus Lethality when using [E] to blow up her target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: This build on Quinn is all about zooming around the map and picking up a ton of kills. Eyeball Collection pays off handsomely granting you plenty of damage from all of these kills.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain an adaptive bonus of 0.6 Attack Damage or 1 Ability Power, per eyeball collected.

Upon completing your collection at 20 eyeballs, gain an adaptive bonus of 6 Attack Damage, or 10 Ability Power.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: More Movement Speed means getting back to lane quicker and putting pressure on any lane when you're not seen by the enemy vision. Roam a LOT.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: This rune setup on Quinn is all about Movement Speed and getting around the map to find kills. Celerity's synergy with Predator, Relentless Hunter, and your [R] gives you a ton of AD to blow up your target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Nullifying orb is a stylistic choice here and a very flexible slot.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Upon taking magic damage that would reduce Health below 30%, grants a shield that absorbs 40 - 120 magic damage based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD) for 4 seconds.

Cooldown: 60s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Grants a magic shield when taken to low health by magic damage.

primary_data.stone_why: The extra bit of burst damage from Electrocute allows you to quickly execute enemy champions with your [R]->[Q]->[E] combo.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Relentless Hunter lets you zoom around the map to find fights and kills and the drop of a hat.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Triumph's extra burst of healing on kills/assists allows you to play aggressively by diving the back-line, killing your target, and getting out safely thanks to the extra bit of health back.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace is the go-to rune for extra damage when looking to burst/assassinate squishy back-line targets as quickly as possible.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

builds.title: Keep Punching
builds.description: Dive, blow up your target, and get out alive.

primary_data.stone_why: Like Courage of the Colossus, Aftershock allows you to dive into a fight and survive thanks to the bonus resists. The explosion damage also assists in killing your target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Damage: 40-140 (+3.5% your maximum health)
Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: Unflinching helps mitigate slows and CC so you can get to your desired target and kill them.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance by 10% for each Summoner Spell on cooldown. After casting a Summoner Spell, gain 15% additional Tenacity and Slow Resistance for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

primary_data.stone_why: The early bonus armor from Iron Skin helps a lot in providing you with a healthy early clear of the jungle.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: The health scaling from Overgrowth helps you survive dives in teamfights and scales very well with the bonus resists from Aftershock.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 8 monsters or enemy minions that die near you permanently increases your max health by 0.2%.

Range: 1400 units
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Minions that die nearby give max health.

secondary_data.stone_why: Attack Speed is incredibly important to a fast and healthy jungle clear, and this is your only source of it.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

secondary_data.stone_why: Vi is all about ulting someone and blowing up that target as fast as possible, and Coup De Grace is deigned to do just that.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

rune_secondary.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

primary_data.stone_why: Rakan excels at engaging and CCing the enemy team, but he naturally needs help survive the engage. The resists provided by Aftershock let you get in and get out.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: Rakan naturally itemizes to empower his heals and shields and thanks to his AoE CC he is able to proc Font of Life on multiple targets and provide even more healing.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them for 4s.

Ally champions who attack marked enemies heal for 5 + 1% of your max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Allies heal when attacking enemies you impair | Think old Stoneborne Pact.

primary_data.stone_why: Condition is a great all-around defensive rune that synergizes with Aftershock to help you survive engages that you otherwise shouldn't'.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: Revitalize is great at empowering Rakan's heals from items, Font of Life, and [Q] as well as his passive and [E] shielding.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

secondary_data.stone_why: Rakan naturally has long cooldowns on his abilities because they are naturally so powerful. The more CDR you're able to stack the more utility you provide.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: The Ultimate Hat doubles down on Rakan's signature of engaging teamfights with his ult. More ults = more teamfight wins.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

primary_data.stone_why: Like Thunderlords, Electrocute is a fantastic and reliable source of damage thanks to her semi-long range abilities and auto-attack range.

build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus true damage to impaired (slowed etc.) champions.

primary_data.stone_why: Ghost Poro is fantastic for providing reliable and safe lane-safety warding so you can pressure for kills and play aggressively.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Enter a brush to summon a poro after a brief channel. The poro will stay behind to give you vision until you summon a new one.

If an enemy enters a brush with a poro in it, they scare it away, putting this effect on a 3s cooldown.

Poro channel is interrupted if you enter combat with a champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Entering a brush leaves temporary vision behind.

primary_data.stone_why: Spell Vamp is a key stat in coming out ahead in high damage trades in mid-lane.

Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: As Syndra if you're able to stay healthy and on the move while casting your abilities the bonus AP will give you immense kill pressure with [R].

build_keystone.stone_long_description: While above 70% health, gain an adaptive bonus of up to 24 Attack Damage or 40 Ability Power (based on level).
build_keystone.stone_short_description: When above 70% health, gain extra AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Gathering Storm acts as a late-game insurance policy to help you execute your target and close out games.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD

50 min: + 120 AP or 72 AD
60 min: + 168 AP or 101 AD
etc...

primary_data.stone_why: The bonus damage on an exposed enemy from Press the Attack synergies very well with Xayah's [W] bonus damage.

builds.title: A Little Star Fire
builds.description: Map mobility pressure and teamfight scaling.

primary_data.stone_why: Aurelion Sol's damage mechanics rely almost entirely on his ability to position himself well from moment to moment. The Movement Speed burst from Phase Rush lets you chase and stay in perfect range for follow-up [W] hits.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting an enemy champion with 3 attacks or separate abilities within 3s grants 10 - 40% Movement Speed based on level.

Duration: 3s
Cooldown: 15s
Additionally, gain 75% Slow Resistance or the duration.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks or abilities grants speed boost | Think old Stormraider's.

primary_data.stone_why: Sol's massive lac of mobility makes him incredibly vulnerable to jungle ganks and mage assassins like LeBlanc. Nullifying Orb helps you survive those ganks and all-ins so that you can scale into the mid game without being way behind.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Upon taking magic damage that would reduce Health below 30%, grants a shield that absorbs 40 - 120 magic damage based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD) for 4 seconds.

Cooldown: 60s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Grants a magic shield when taken to low health by magic damage.

primary_data.stone_why: Again, mobility is the name of the game for Sol. Combined with his [E] passive Movement Speed, Celerity will grant you very reliable bonus AP.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Waterwalking is a great rune to take on Sol when you're looking to get the early shove and roam to the side lanes for map pressure.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 25 Movement Speed and an adaptive bonus of up to 18 Attack Damage or 30 Ability Power (based on level) when in the river.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain MS and AP or AD, when in the river.

secondary_data.stone_why: Presence of mind on Sol allows you to pick up multiple kills and assists in teamfights and keep your [W] on for extended periods of time without fear of mana constraints.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: For 7s after gaining a level or takedown the mana you spend on abilities is fully restored.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Level ups / Kills / Assists give free mana for 5 seconds.

secondary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace is the go-to rune for consistent damage amp when looking to finish off targets.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.

primary_data.stone_why: Like Courage but with damage, Thresh can easily proc Aftershock and it adds to his kill potential if you can land the explosion.

After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: Font of Life is a great rune on Thresh as he has multiple tools of proccing it with [Q], [E], and [R], providing a lot of healing in lane trades and team fights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them for 4s.

Ally champions who attack marked enemies heal for 5 + 1% of your max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Allies heal when attacking enemies you impair | Think old Stoneborne Pact.

primary_data.stone_why: The Armor from Iron Skin is incredibly valuable in lane trades, especially when looking for that level 2 engage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: Second Wind's in-combat sustain further empowers your ability to take trades, and the health you regenerate back is multiplicative with the armor from Iron Skin.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

secondary_data.stone_why: Future's Market on Thresh allows you to stretch your limited gold income into much faster high utility item power spikes like Locket, redemption, etc.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
You can enter debt to buy items. The amount you can borrow increases over time.

Debt limit: 150 + 5/min
Lending Fee: 50 gold per item
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Enter debt to buy items early.

secondary_data.stone_why: The extra bit of Summoner and Spell CDR on Thresh pays off big when you are looking for big game-winning plays like Flash->[Q] etc. The extra bit of CDR also allows you to provide more utility and CC in teamfights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

builds.title: Thresh Prince
builds.description: Jack of all trades. Spam item actives.

primary_data.stone_why: Like Courage but with damage, Thresh can easily proc Aftershock and it adds to his kill potential if you can land the explosion.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Damage: 40-140 (+3.5% your maximum health)
Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: Font of Life is a great rune on Thresh as he has multiple tools of proccing it with [Q], [E], and [R], providing a lot of healing in lane trades and team fights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them for 4s.

Ally champions who attack marked enemies heal for 5 + 1% of your max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Allies heal when attacking enemies you impair | Think old Stoneborne Pact.

primary_data.stone_why: The Armor from Iron Skin is incredibly valuable in lane trades, especially when looking for that level 2 engage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: Second Wind's in-combat sustain further empowers your ability to take trades, and the health you regenerate back is multiplicative with the armor from Iron Skin.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

secondary_data.stone_why: Like Font of Life, Thresh has 3 ([Q], [E], and [R]) strong tools for proccing Cheap Shot empowering your lane for even more kill pressure.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging champions with impaired movement or actions deals 12 - 30 bonus true damage (based on level).

Cooldown: 4s
Applies to damage occurring after the impairment.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus true damage to impaired (slowed etc.) champions.

secondary_data.stone_why: To key to being a useful support is effective warding and Zombie Ward shines in this department.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Rest in Peace
builds.description: Massive damage scaling and kill threat.

primary_data.stone_why: If you're able to slow the enemy with [W] first, your Comet is almost guaranteed to hit. Karthus is also able to quickly bring Comet back off cooldown by landing multiple [Q]s in quick succession.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: Karthus' [R] has a massive cooldown so every point of CDR is that much more valuable. At max stacks your ult will be up 24s sooner.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

primary_data.stone_why: Absolute Focus is a rune that can provide incredible amount of AP in situations where you're able to sit back and provide damage. In the case of Karthus, stay healthy in lane and look for an early cross-map [R].

build_keystone.stone_long_description: While above 70% health, gain an adaptive bonus of up to 24 Attack Damage or 40 Ability Power (based on level).
build_keystone.stone_short_description: When above 70% health, gain extra AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: There's not much to say here expect for 'Scaling'. Karth can be one of the hardest scaling AP Mages just by the nature of his [R]. A 40min game means you'll be hitting like a truck.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 10 min. gain AP or AD, Adaptive.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD
20 min: + 24 AP or 14 AD
30 min: + 48 AP or 29 AD
40 min: + 80 AP or 48 AD
50 min: + 120 AP or 72 AD
60 min: + 168 AP or 101 AD
etc...
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Every 10 minutes gain stacking AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Karth can make great use of Coup De Grace, synergizing well with both is [R] for executions, and when he's in his passive form looking to finish a target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Karthus can actually make pretty surprisingly great use of Presence of Mind with his [E] during teamfights. Pick up kills/assists and that'll empower you to keep your [E] on for free for another 5s.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: For 7s after gaining a level or takedown the mana you spend on abilities is fully restored.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Level ups / Kills / Assists give free mana for 5 seconds.

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Health Stack on Health Stack
builds.description: Doubling down on health stacking and tankiness.

primary_data.stone_why: Cho'Gath is known for getting insane amounts of health and Grasp exemplifies that, giving even more health and damage for being so tanky.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 4s in combat, your next basic attack on a champion will:

  • Deal bonus damage equal to 4% of your max health
  • Heal you for 2% of your max health
  • Permanently increase your health by 5

Ranged Champions: Damage and healing are halved and gain 2 permanent health instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus damage / heal based on max health. Permanent max health.

primary_data.stone_why: All that stacking max health allows you to easily do half a tower's health with a single auto-attack with Demolish

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Charge up a powerful attack against a tower over 4s, when within 600 range of it. The charged attack deals 125 (+30% of your max health) bonus physical damage.

Cooldown: 45s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tower burst damage based on max health.

primary_data.stone_why: Effective health comes from multiplying health with resists. Grasp and and you ultimate stacking health pairs very nicely with Conditioning to make you very tanky.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: Overgrow multiplies and scales incredibly well as you continue to gain health from Feast stacks and Grasp health gained.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 8 monsters or enemy minions that die near you permanently increases your max health by 0.2%.

Range: 1400 units
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Minions that die nearby give max health.

secondary_data.stone_why: As a big beefy front-liner, Cho'gath absorbs a massive amount of damage in teamfights while standing in the front line. Triumph allows you to pick up assists with your AoE and still stay heathy and unkillable.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Cho's biggest weakness is his lack of mobility and that is heavily abused with CC. Additional Tenacity with further enable you to get to your target or escape ganks safely.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 5% tenacity plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

primary_data.stone_why: The flat Armor from Iron Skin pays off big in your early jungle clears, keeping you healthy for ganks. The secondary bonus also synergizes well with your itemization.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: Second Wind is a great mid fight sustain rune and the heath regenerate pair very well with Aftershock's bonus resists making you incredibly resilient early in fights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

secondary_data.stone_why: Gathering Storm is an overall solid rune choice on Amumu as it allows you still build full tank and rely on this as your sole source of offensive power in late games.

etc...

secondary_data.stone_why: Amumu's [R] is the reason why you pick him. Taking the Ultimate Hat allows you to use your ult a bit more literally in small skirmishes and still have it up for big team fights.

After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 8 monsters or enemy minions that die near you permanently increases your max health by 0.2%.

secondary_data.stone_why: Relentless Hunter's stacking Movement Speed combined with your [Q] allows you to get to any fight or skirmish on the map at the drop of a hat.

Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

builds.title: Bird is the Word
builds.description: Massive scaling damage and Zhonya's safety.

primary_data.stone_why: Anivia's damage almost always comes with a stun or slow, allowing for a much more reliable hit rate on Arcane Comet.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Band is a great rune on mid laners who stack multiple mana items (Tear, RoA etc.), providing even more mana return.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: Typical choice here for mid mages. CDR is always a great stat for trading and doing more damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Anivia is a champion who can very easily stall the game thanks to her [R] waveclear, and thus she can get some insane AP from forcing a stalled-out game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 10 min. gain AP or AD, Adaptive.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD
20 min: + 24 AP or 14 AD
30 min: + 48 AP or 29 AD
40 min: + 80 AP or 48 AD
50 min: + 120 AP or 72 AD
60 min: + 168 AP or 101 AD
etc...

secondary_data.stone_why: Perfect Timing allows you to get a cheaper Zhonya's after Archangel's + RoA giving you a massive mid-game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

secondary_data.stone_why: Cosmic Insight provides a lot of defensive power in the form of Summoner Cooldown and Item Cooldown for Zhonya's/Archangel's.

+5% CDR

+5% Item CDR

Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Sudden Impact empowers Shaco's damage in ganks when using [Q]. He also makes great use of both the Lethality and Magic Pen thanks to his mixed damage profile.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: Eyeball Collection is a great rune choice on champions who rely heavily on early snowball kills and those who build Duskblade for the faster ward-sweeping stacks.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain an adaptive bonus of 0.6 Attack Damage or 1 Ability Power, per eyeball collected.

Upon completing your collection at 20 eyeballs, gain an adaptive bonus of 6 Attack Damage, or 10 Ability Power.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Relentless Hunt on Shaco allows you to cover more ground during the [Q] stealth so that you're able to position perfectly for the kill.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: The bonus Attack Speed empowers Shaco's ability to quickly clear the jungle for early ganks. It also empowers the damage of your ganks by allowing you to get off an extra auto attack or more during your combo.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

builds.title: Frugal Falsetto
builds.description: Super efficient item power-spikes and gold saving.

primary_data.stone_why: This rune setup is all about hitting item power-spikes as soon as possible and the bonus gold you get some Klepto can pay itself off insanely quickly if you're playing into an easy melee support lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After using an ability, your next attack on a champion grants bonus gold. There's a chance you'll also gain a consumable.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks after spells on champions grant gold and consumables | Procs like Sheen.

primary_data.stone_why: We are looking to save and earn as much gold as we possibly can with this setup and Biscuits (combined with Klepto) allows us to rely on these for sustain, saving you 100s of gold to put into other items.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Biscuit Delivery: Gain a Total Biscuit of Everlasting will every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes.

Biscuits restore 15% of your missing health and mana and increase your mana cap by 40 mana permanently.

Champions without mana restore 20% missing energy instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Periodically gain a biscuit with strong Health/Mana regen.

primary_data.stone_why: Continuing the pattern, Magical Footwear is just another source of raw gold income in the form of frugality.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: You get Slightly Magical Boots at 10 min, but you cannot buy boots before then. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free boots at 10 minutes.

primary_data.stone_why: Cosmic Insight is simply an overall fantastic rune choice on any champion in the game, but especially supports as they can make great use of the extra item CDR.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

secondary_data.stone_why: You're looking to poke and harass a lot with [Q]->auto in lane, for both pressure as well as Kleptomancy procs. To keep this up and earn as much gold as possible, you're going to need the mana sustain.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

secondary_data.stone_why: Because this loadout focuses heavily on [Q] spam and poke in lane, Scorch is a natural option to further empower that damage and keep the pressure up.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

rune_main.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Summon Aery is a great option for Sona both offensively (with autos and [Q]) and defensively (with [W]).

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging enemies or shielding allies.

Damage: 15 - 40 based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD)
Shield: 30 - 80 based on level (+0.25 AP and +0.4 bonus AD)

Aery cannot be sent out to again until she returns to you.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks/abilities summon Aery to damage enemies / shield allies.

primary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Band is a great option here for Sona because you're going to want to  play aggressively in lane early spamming [Q].

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: Like all support Transcendence is the best option here as it scales really well with your itemization.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch allows you to dominate the lane phase if you're able to consistently poke with your [Q].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: To key to being a useful support is effective warding and Zombie Ward shines in this department keeping vision up for you even more.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

secondary_data.stone_why: Sona's itemization is ripe for active items (Locket, Redemption, etc.). Pair Ingenious Hunter's item CDR with Ruby Sightstone and you'll be able to spam your items.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% Active Item CDR plus an additional 6% per Bounty Hunter stack (includes Trinkets).

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Item & Trinket CDR stacks from unique kills / assists.

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

primary_data.stone_why: Aery is a rune that is lauded for it's reliability. While less damage that Comet, it cannot miss allowing you to harass for a little bit more with [Q] in lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging enemies or shielding allies.

Damage: 15 - 40 based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD)
Shield: 30 - 80 based on level (+0.25 AP and +0.4 bonus AD)

Aery cannot be sent out to again until she returns to you.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks/abilities summon Aery to damage enemies / shield allies.

primary_data.stone_why: Thanks to the already short cooldown on Kassadin's [R], he is able to get full Ultimate Hat stacks very quickly. This lets you take a few extra Riftwalks in the mid game for chasing kills/escaping, where you other wise not be able to.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

primary_data.stone_why: Kassadin is a champion who often forgoes early CDR for a stacking item like RoA and Transcendence helps patch some of that up.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch is a rune that, like Aery, is very strong and reliable during lane. These two combined make for a strong poking tool with [Q].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Cosmic Insight is a stable and safe rune pick for any champion in any position, especially those who take Teleport and might look to match an enemy TP right off cooldown.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

secondary_data.stone_why: The early stasis active from Perfect timing opens up opportunities for early game outplays and towers dives while also acting as a raw gold value toward a core item.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

builds.title: There’s no turning back
builds.description: Sustained fighting power and ramping damage.

primary_data.stone_why: The bonus exposure damage from Press the Attack further empowers your auto attacks and lets you deal immense ramping damage in extended duels.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 consecutive basic attacks will deal 30 - 120 bonus adaptive damage (based on level) and makes them vulnerable, increasing the damage they take by 12% from all sources for 6s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Triumph is an all-around solid rune choice. In 2v2s and 2v1s, the extra healing can be enough to grant you the ability to sustain and move on to the next target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: The majority of Irelia's damage comes in the form of her Auto Attacks thanks to her [W]. Alacrity grants you the opportunity for an additional 1-2 autos when the enemy is stunned with [E]

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace allows Irelia to continue chipping away at her target until their life bar is fully depleted.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Second Wind is a fantastic mid-fight sustain rune when taking small-medium trades in lane. It allows you to stay healthy as you beat on your target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

secondary_data.stone_why: Iron Skin is a great rune for early-game dueling power. The bonus armor is extra beneficial with the healing from your [W] and sustain from Second Wind.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

rune_secondary.rune_description: +130 Health

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Champions, large minions, and large monsters drop soul essence on death. Collecting a soul to become Soul Charged. Your next attack on a champion or structure consumes Soul Charged to deal bonus adaptive damage.

Soul Charged lasts 20s, increased to 300s after collecting 150 soul essence.

Bonus damage: 40 - 80 (+0.25 bonus AD) (+0.2 AP) + soul essence collected.

Champion souls - 6 soul essence.
Monster souls - 2 soul essence.
Minion souls - 4 soul essence.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Nearby dying large minions / monsters / champions grants burst damage.
