Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: Eyeball Collection is all about fighting from the get-go and getting takedowns to scale into the mid-game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain an adaptive bonus of 0.6 Attack Damage or 1 Ability Power, per eyeball collected.

Upon completing your collection at 20 eyeballs, gain an adaptive bonus of 6 Attack Damage, or 10 Ability Power.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Because Kayn likes to duel and spam his abilities, Ravenous Hunter provides a lot of extra healing in those fights. It also pairs nicely with Rhaast's passive.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: A big part of Rhaast's power comes from the healing on his passive and Revitalize further pushes that healing.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

secondary_data.stone_why: Conditioning provides a stable amount of defensive power heading into the mid-game to allow you to take longer duration trades in any lane gank.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: Arcane Comet is a reasonably good rune for Zoe in the laning phase thanks to her ability to poke repeatedly with [Q].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: Zoe's super low cooldown on [R] allows her to almost instantly get the full stack benefit of Ultimate Hat keeping it at an even shorter cooldown.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.

builds.title: Teach ‘Em a Harsh Lesson
builds.description: Lane sustain, pressure, and item scaling.

primary_data.stone_why: Illaoi is one of the few melee champions who can reliably proc Kleptomancy in short trades. Her [W] allows her to quickly proc the effect for extra gold and sustain.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After using an ability, your next attack on a champion grants bonus gold. There's a chance you'll also gain a consumable.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks after spells on champions grant gold and consumables | Procs like Sheen.

primary_data.stone_why: Biscuit Delivery combined with the extra potions that you loot with Klepto allows you to take short lane trades and out-sustain your opponent laner.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Biscuit Delivery: Gain a Total Biscuit of Everlasting will every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes.

Biscuits restore 15% of your missing health and mana and increase your mana cap by 40 mana permanently.

Champions without mana restore 20% missing energy instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Periodically gain a biscuit with strong Health/Mana regen.

primary_data.stone_why: Magical Footwear is a stable and reliable rune on all champions as it acts effectively as a free kill's worth of gold at 10mins allowing you to hit  damage power spikes a little sooner.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: You get Slightly Magical Boots at 10 min, but you cannot buy boots before then. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free boots at 10 minutes.

primary_data.stone_why: Celestial Body is your primary form of defensive stats from runes. This setup opts heavily for damage and sustain, with very little defense. Celestial Body acts as a means of making sure you don't get blown up early in the game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+100 Health permanently
-10% damage to champions and monsters until 10 mins.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +100 health | Less damage until 10 minutes.

secondary_data.stone_why: Sudden Impact is a great rune choice for maximum damage on Illaoi as her [W] leap counts as a dash, granting you Lethality for every bit of damage afterwards.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

secondary_data.stone_why: Ravenous Hunter's extra bit of Spell Vamp is incredibly strong when paired with Illaoi's high base damage on her abilities and Tentacle Slams, allows you to do sustain through any incoming damage while you blow up the enemy team.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Healing: 2.5% + 2.5% per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%

primary_data.stone_why: Azir is a champion who typically doesn't opt for a mana item, rushing Nashor's tooth and Magic Penetration. Manaflow allows you to supplement that loss of mana sustain and continue pumping out damage in the early to imd game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

Cooldown: 20s

Shield is built up from 40% of excess healing from self, or 300% of excess healing from allies.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Excess incoming heals become a shield (includes lifesteal etc.)

primary_data.stone_why: Kalista is an AD Carry that tends to stack more Life Steal than most others and Bloodline doubles down on that.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 0.8% life steal for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Life Steal stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace works fantastically with Kalista's desire to execute her targets with [E].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Thanks to the leap from her passive, Kalista can keep the Lethality buff from Sudden Impact for the entirely of the game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

secondary_data.stone_why: Ghost Poro is a solid rune for providing on-demand vision for the tri-bush or lane bushes.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Enter a brush to summon a poro after a brief channel. The poro will stay behind to give you vision until you summon a new one.

If an enemy enters a brush with a poro in it, they scare it away, putting this effect on a 3s cooldown.

Poro channel is interrupted if you enter combat with a champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Entering a brush leaves temporary vision behind.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: All About Them Shields and Heals

primary_data.stone_why: Summon Aery makes Janna's [E] an incredibly strong and reliable shield.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging enemies or shielding allies.

Damage: 15 - 40 based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD)
Shield: 30 - 80 based on level (+0.25 AP and +0.4 bonus AD)

Aery cannot be sent out to again until she returns to you.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks/abilities summon Aery to damage enemies / shield allies.

primary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Band acts as our primary source of mana sustain in lane, allowing you to spam abilities more often for trades.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: Like all Enchanter supports, cooldown reduction is a key stat for direct power.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Thanks to her passive, Janna is heavily focused on moving quickly around the map and Waterwalking helps with that.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 25 Movement Speed and an adaptive bonus of up to 18 Attack Damage or 30 Ability Power (based on level) when in the river.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain MS and AP or AD, when in the river.

secondary_data.stone_why: The bonus shielding and healing from Revitalize makes Janna's [E] and [R] very powerful, especially in clutch situations.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

secondary_data.stone_why: Early lane trading heavily relies around having armor as minion damage is a major source of incoming damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +130 Health

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Bankplank Mid
builds.description: Lane sustain, money stacking, and global pressure.

primary_data.stone_why: Gangplank is one of the biggest abusers of Kleptomancy thanks to his on-hit [Q]. Klepto will provide you with a ton of sustain/gold and occasionally more AD.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After using an ability, your next attack on a champion grants bonus gold. There's a chance you'll also gain a consumable.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks after spells on champions grant gold and consumables | Procs like Sheen.

primary_data.stone_why: Perfect Timing is a great rune when looking to get an early/cheaper Guardian Angel.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
You can enter debt to buy items. The amount you can borrow increases over time.

Debt limit: 150 + 5/min
Lending Fee: 50 gold per item
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Enter debt to buy items early.

primary_data.stone_why: More CDR means more [Q]s which means for Klepto procs which means more gold... You get the idea.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

secondary_data.stone_why: One of GP's most underrated aspects of his kit is his global presence. A few well-placed/timed [R]s in the early game can make or break a lead. More [R]s mean more map presence.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

secondary_data.stone_why: There is no stat that GP likes more than CDR. His [E] heavily relies on having a lot of CDR because you're going to miss a lot of barrels.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

rune_main.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

builds.title: Consider Them Spanked
builds.description: Lane safety and massive scaling damage.

primary_data.stone_why: Fleet Footwork provides both great lane sustain as well as well as the movement speed needed to position for follow-up damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Attacking a moving builds Energy stacks. At 100 stacks, your next attack is Energized.

Energized attacks heal you for 3 - 60 (+0.30 bonus AD, +0.40 AP) and grant 30% increased Movement Speed for 1s.

Healing is 60% as effective when used on a minion.
If the attack that activates Fleet Footwork is a critical hit, Fleet Footwork's healing is increased by 40% of your critical damage modifier
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Lane sustain | Engage Movement. Think old Warlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Triumph is a great rune for champions who like to take small skirmishes. The bonus gold also helps accelerate you to a faster Tri-Force if you pick a few early game kills/assists.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Most of your lane opponent will have forms of deadly Crowd Control. Tenacity is a huge key to successfully escaping jungle ganks.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 5% tenacity plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Corki can be one of the burstiest champions in the game thanks to his strong Sheen procs. Coup De Grace lets empower that burst even further on squishy targets.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Gathering Strom's late game scaling AD makes you an insanely scary threat in the mid to late game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 10 min. gain AP or AD, Adaptive.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD
20 min: + 24 AP or 14 AD
30 min: + 48 AP or 29 AD
40 min: + 80 AP or 48 AD
50 min: + 120 AP or 72 AD
60 min: + 168 AP or 101 AD
etc...
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Every 10 minutes gain stacking AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Nullifying Orb acts very similarly to a Hex Drinker shield allowing you to take some aggressive trades with burst mages with relative safety.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Upon taking magic damage that would reduce Health below 30%, grants a shield that absorbs 40 - 120 magic damage based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD) for 4 seconds.

Cooldown: 60s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Grants a magic shield when taken to low health by magic damage.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. builds.title: Act With Conviction
builds.description: Mix of utility and early-game strength.

primary_data.stone_why: Karma's kit allows her to effectively proc Aery offensively in the early game for harass, and defensively with [E] for massive shields.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging enemies or shielding allies.

Damage: 15 - 40 based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD)
Shield: 30 - 80 based on level (+0.25 AP and +0.4 bonus AD)

Aery cannot be sent out to again until she returns to you.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks/abilities summon Aery to damage enemies / shield allies.

primary_data.stone_why: Karma is one of the biggest abusers of The Ultimate Hat thanks to having access to her [R] at level 1.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

primary_data.stone_why: Like all Enchanter supports, Karma scales incredibly well with CDR and Transcendence allows us to hit the CDR cap without fear.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Karma has one of the most dominant lane phases of any support and Scorch lets us push that even further.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Like all Enchanter supports, Karma scales incredibly well with CDR and Cosmic Insight gives us all the tools we need to dominate.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

secondary_data.stone_why: Free boots effectively means we are getting a free kills worth of gold at 10mins allows us to spec into other items quicker.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: You get Slightly Magical Boots at 10 min, but you cannot buy boots before then. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free boots at 10 minutes.

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Truly Outrageous
builds.description: Powerful Heals, Shields, and Active Items.

primary_data.stone_why: Guardian synergizes well with Taric's [W] when looking to block big incoming damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Guard allies within 175 units of you, and Guard allies you target with spells for 2.5s. While Guarding, if you or the ally would take damage, both of you gain a shield and are hasted for 1.5s.

Cooldown: 45s
Shield Strength: 60 - 150 (+0.20 AP) (+10% bonus health).
Haste: 20% increased Movement Speed
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Haste and shield allies you are near or cast a spell on.

primary_data.stone_why: Taric loves to build Increased Healing/Shielding items so proccing Font of Life with [E] will result is a lot of healing for your teammates when you they hit the enemy champions.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them for 4s.

Ally champions who attack marked enemies heal for 5 + 1% of your max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Allies heal when attacking enemies you impair | Think old Stoneborne Pact.

primary_data.stone_why: Iron Skin grants Armor to allow healthy trading in lane as well as great synergy with [W]. If youre playing into a passive lane (like Janna) you can be greedy and opt for less lane power and strong mid-game with Conditioning.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: Revitalize synergizes well with both [Q] healing strength and Locket shielding. If you're expecting to take a lot of poke in lane, Second Wind is a good option for sustain.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

secondary_data.stone_why: A large portion of a support's power comes from item actives and Ingenious Hunter helps to make sure you have Locket and Redemption up as often as possible, granting 40% item/trinket CDR at max stacks.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% Active Item CDR plus an additional 6% per Bounty Hunter stack (includes Trinkets).

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Item & Trinket CDR stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Zombie ward is a great rune choice on any support as it scales your vision score incredibly well along side Sightstone.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Veigar can easily proc Electrocute with [E]->[W]->[Q] because abilities do not need to do damage to count toward the separate proc counter.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: If you successfully hit your target with [E] the bonus True Damage will help secure the kill before they even come out of the stun.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging champions with impaired movement or actions deals 12 - 30 bonus true damage (based on level).

Cooldown: 4s
Applies to damage occurring after the impairment.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus true damage to impaired (slowed etc.) champions.

primary_data.stone_why: Keeping wards up on the sides of lane is one of the most important things you can do as a mid-laner. Ghost Poro, while small, provides very reliable vision.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Enter a brush to summon a poro after a brief channel. The poro will stay behind to give you vision until you summon a new one.

If an enemy enters a brush with a poro in it, they scare it away, putting this effect on a 3s cooldown.

Poro channel is interrupted if you enter combat with a champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Entering a brush leaves temporary vision behind.

primary_data.stone_why: The Spell vamp from Ravenous Hunter scales incredibly well with Veigar's natural high damage scaling, allowing you to survive tough fights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Healing: 2.5% + 2.5% per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Veigar is the master of AP scaling and Gathering Storm is the ultimate scaling rune.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 10 min. gain AP or AD, Adaptive.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD
20 min: + 24 AP or 14 AD
30 min: + 48 AP or 29 AD
40 min: + 80 AP or 48 AD
50 min: + 120 AP or 72 AD
60 min: + 168 AP or 101 AD
etc...
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Every 10 minutes gain stacking AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: The raw utility of Veigar's [E] increases the importance of CDR. Transcendence allows you to potentially spec into less CDR.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

rune_main.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Trundle is one of the best users of Grasp thanks to his innate auto-attack based kit and stickyness with [Q] and [E].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 4s in combat, your next basic attack on a champion will:

  • Deal bonus damage equal to 4% of your max health
  • Heal you for 2% of your max health
  • Permanently increase your health by 5

Ranged Champions: Damage and healing are halved and gain 2 permanent health instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus damage / heal based on max health. Permanent max health.

primary_data.stone_why: If left alone Trundle is one of the fastest split-pushers. [Q] + Demolish means you'll be cutting down towers in no time.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Charge up a powerful attack against a tower over 4s, when within 600 range of it. The charged attack deals 125 (+30% of your max health) bonus physical damage.

Cooldown: 45s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tower burst damage based on max health.

primary_data.stone_why: The early armor from Iron skin lets your take trades early and heal off any damage with your passive.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: Revitalize synergizes incredibly well with Trundle's natural healing from his passive and [R]. It also synergizes well with Font of Life and Overheal.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

secondary_data.stone_why: Trundle could always use more auto-attacks and this is your only source of Attack Speed.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

secondary_data.stone_why: Overheal synergizes incredible well with Trundle's Passive, [R], and Revitalize allowing you to enter fights healthy.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Excess healing on you becomes a shield, for up to 10% of your total health + 10.

Shield is built up from 40% of excess healing from self, or 300% of excess healing from allies.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Excess incoming heals become a shield (includes lifesteal etc.)

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

builds.title: Where Do You Think You’re going?
builds.description: Lane dominance, chase, and kill potential.

primary_data.stone_why: Gnar loves to build Frozen Mallet and this rune allows you to bypass the item while still getting the same benefits. Hit an auto-attack and chase down your enemy proccing as many [W]'s as possible.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Basic attacking a champion slows them for 2s. The slow increases in strength over its duration.

  • Ranged attacks slow by up to 20%-40%
  • Melee attacks slow by up to 40%-50%

Slowing a champion with active items shoots a freeze ray through them, freezing the nearby ground for 5s, slowing all units inside by 50%

Cooldown: 7-4s second per-unit cooldown
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Slow enemies on hit. Active slows cast AoE slow.

primary_data.stone_why: Perfect Timing serves double duty in both providing a clutch 1-time Zhonya's active as well as saving you gold on purchasing Gargoyle's Stoneplate.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
You can enter debt to buy items. The amount you can borrow increases over time.

Debt limit: 150 + 5/min
Lending Fee: 50 gold per item
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Enter debt to buy items early.

primary_data.stone_why: Approach Velocity is actually a very valuable and abusable rune when paired with Glacial Augment. Glacial's slow paired with Approach's Movement Speed will let you hit land more auto attacks than otherwise possible

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% Movement Speed towards nearby allies that are movement impaired or enemies that you impair.

Range: 1000
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Movement speed towards impaired allies / enemies.

secondary_data.stone_why: Gnar loves a lot of attack speed to abuse his range and proc his [W] as often as possible in melee matchups. With Glacial Augment these rune becomes even more powerful.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

secondary_data.stone_why: Between Press the Attack and repeated procs of Gnar's [W] you should be able to quickly whittle the enemy champion to 40% health and get the bonus damage to kill them.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

rune_main.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Gnar's biggest Top Lane strength is abusing melee champions with his range. Press the Attack's exposed bonus damage makes Gnar's [W] an incredible threat.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 consecutive basic attacks will deal 30 - 120 bonus adaptive damage (based on level) and makes them vulnerable, increasing the damage they take by 12% from all sources for 6s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Triumph means more health and gold on kills and because you're looking to duel, kill, and escape safely this is the best option in this row.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Gnar loves a lot of attack speed to abuse his range and proc his [W] as often as possible in melee matchups.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Between Press the Attack and repeated procs of Gnar's [W] you should be able to quickly whittle the enemy champion to 40% health and get the bonus damage to kill them.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Gnar shines when he's able to pressure his lane, split push, and take towers. Demolish is key in taking those towers and scales well with Gnar's natural health stacking.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Charge up a powerful attack against a tower over 4s, when within 600 range of it. The charged attack deals 125 (+30% of your max health) bonus physical damage.

Cooldown: 45s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tower burst damage based on max health.

secondary_data.stone_why: Conditioning is a great all-around defensive rune choice. If you're looking for more lane pressure feel free to take Iron Skin or Mirror Shell depending on the matchup.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +130 Health

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Aftershock is the go-to rune on any engage tank. After jumping in with [E], the bonus Armor and MR allows your to survive the engage while sticking to your target and CCing them.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Damage: 40-140 (+3.5% your maximum health)
Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: Unflinching allows you to continue to stick to your target after jumping in. After Zac has engaged with[E], it can be difficult to stay on top of enemy champions and spam [W] (your primary source damage).

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance by 10% for each Summoner Spell on cooldown. After casting a Summoner Spell, gain 15% additional Tenacity and Slow Resistance for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

primary_data.stone_why: Conditioning scales well with Aftershock, as both of them buff each other. The bonus resist from Aftershock make Conditioning stronger, and Conditioning resists after 10mins make Aftershock stronger.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: Zac does a lot of natural self healing when he pick ups his bobs. Revitalize empowers your jungle clear with a much healthier first clear.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

secondary_data.stone_why: Transcendence allows you to bypass early game CDR for more defensive based items (Randuins etc.) while still granting you the CDR for [W] spam and CC lockup.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Scorch heavily empowers your early to mid game ganks opening the opportunity for snowballing lanes.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Thanks to his passive, Bard is able to easily proc electrocute for huge burst with either Auto->[Q] or Auto->Auto.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Once you've collected 5 chimes Bard's passive auto attacks slow, proccing Cheap Shot. Paired with Bard's [Q] you'll be permanently slowing and dealing True Damage to any target you wish.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging champions with impaired movement or actions deals 12 - 30 bonus true damage (based on level).

Cooldown: 4s
Applies to damage occurring after the impairment.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus true damage to impaired (slowed etc.) champions.

primary_data.stone_why: Zombie Ward is a great rune choice in this slot as it synergizes well with Sightstone and Bard's natural roaming nature, allowing him to get deeper wards more often.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

primary_data.stone_why: Relentless Hunter further empowers Bard's ability to roam the map, collect chimes, and get to any fight.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Scorch on Bard empowers your early laning phase trades to do big damage with kill potential with sustained harass damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Bard can often run low on mana in lane if you're taking a lot of trades due to a high mana cost on [W]. If you cast [W] when Manaflow Band is available you'll sustain quite well allowing for more aggressive trades.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

rune_main.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

builds.title: Honor, Death, and Hangovers
builds.description: Lane sustain/Life Steal and tank shredding

primary_data.stone_why: Yasuo can proc the bonus damage on Press the attack extremely quickly with a [Q] + Auto [Q] allowing you to cut down your foes.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 consecutive basic attacks will deal 30 - 120 bonus adaptive damage (based on level) and makes them vulnerable, increasing the damage they take by 12% from all sources for 6s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Overheal pairs very nicely with some of our other rune choices like Legend: Bloodline and Revitalize to keep us healthy from poke.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Excess healing on you becomes a shield, for up to 10% of your total health + 10.

Shield is built up from 40% of excess healing from self, or 300% of excess healing from allies.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Excess incoming heals become a shield (includes lifesteal etc.)

primary_data.stone_why: Top lane, especially again bruisers, can often be a war of attrition where sustain over a long period of time reign supreme, and Bloodline gives us the Lifesteal to power through.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 0.8% life steal for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Life Steal stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Tanks often dominate the top lane attrition fight and Cut Down excels at chopping those champions at the knees.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Deal 4% more damage to champions with 150 more max health than you, increasing to 10% at 2000 more max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tank killer

secondary_data.stone_why: Freely swap this out with Mirror Shell depending on your lane matchup (Armor or MR) to further out-trade your lane opponent

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

secondary_data.stone_why: Revitalize synergizes so incredibly well with our Life Steal rune setup and Yasuo's passive. Pair that with a BotRK and you'll be hard-pressed to leave lane ever again.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +130 Health

patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Yasuo can proc the bonus damage on Press the attack extremely quickly with a [Q] + Auto [Q] allowing you to cut down your foes.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 consecutive basic attacks will deal 30 - 120 bonus adaptive damage (based on level) and makes them vulnerable, increasing the damage they take by 12% from all sources for 6s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Because this loadouts excels at killing and moving on, Triumph helps you to stay in the fight after kills and continue dealing damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Naturally Yasuo love building Attack Speed. More autos means more crits which means more kills.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: This loadout is all about punishing weak targets swiftly and painlessly. After the kill, move on to the next target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Yasuo is arguably the biggest abuser of Sudden Impact. Think of it as permanent Armor Penetration on every cast of [E] .

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

secondary_data.stone_why: Ghost poro is a great choice in assisting you to avoid early game ganks so you can scale to your kill potential.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Enter a brush to summon a poro after a brief channel. The poro will stay behind to give you vision until you summon a new one.

If an enemy enters a brush with a poro in it, they scare it away, putting this effect on a 3s cooldown.

Poro channel is interrupted if you enter combat with a champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Entering a brush leaves temporary vision behind.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

builds.title: Another Opponent, Another Disappointment
builds.description: Lane harass and sustained teamfight damage.

primary_data.stone_why: Swain is great lane abuser of Comet thanks to the heavy slow from [Q] nearly guaranteeing a hit.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Band allows you to keep up the lane pressure and harassment with constant use of abilities.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: As Swain you should be able to stay within Absolute Focus damage bonus range more than most other champions thanks to the healing from [R] and Ravenous Hunter.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: While above 70% health, gain an adaptive bonus of up to 24 Attack Damage or 40 Ability Power (based on level).
build_keystone.stone_short_description: When above 70% health, gain extra AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch is an incredibly strong early laning rune for pressure and harassment. Look to proc the bonus damage as often as possible with either [Q] or [E].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Once Rylai's has been completed you will be able to repetitively proc Cheap Shot's bonus True Damage in teamfights with [Q], [R], and [E] to multiple targets.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging champions with impaired movement or actions deals 12 - 30 bonus true damage (based on level).

Cooldown: 4s
Applies to damage occurring after the impairment.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus true damage to impaired (slowed etc.) champions.

secondary_data.stone_why: Ravenous Hunter doubles down on the bruiser-healing nature of Swain kit, allowing you to sustain more damage as you dish it out.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Healing: 2.5% + 2.5% per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: All About Them Headshots
builds.description: Lane harass, trades, and sustain with late game damage.

primary_data.stone_why: Fleet Footwork on Caitlyn empowers your ability to take trades early and often in the laning phase thanks to your improved sustain. The extra burst of Movement Speed can also help you position to get in range for the headshot proc on the enemy.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Attacking a moving builds Energy stacks. At 100 stacks, your next attack is Energized.

Energized attacks heal you for 3 - 60 (+0.30 bonus AD, +0.40 AP) and grant 30% increased Movement Speed for 1s.

Healing is 60% as effective when used on a minion.
If the attack that activates Fleet Footwork is a critical hit, Fleet Footwork's healing is increased by 40% of your critical damage modifier
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Lane sustain | Engage Movement. Think old Warlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Triumph is Dangerous Game on steroids, allowing you to push your limits in fights and reset. Oh and bonus kill gold is nice too.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Bloodline further empowers your ability to take lane trades and out sustain your enemy laner thanks to Fleet Footwork and Bloodline's extra bit of healing.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 0.8% life steal for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Life Steal stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Headshots paired with the execute damage of Coup De Grace offers you a lot of burst to finish off your target and move on.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Celerity's bonus Movement Speed helps you to position in teamfights for optimal damage output and skill-shot dodging. Celerity also synergizes well with Zeal items providing you a little extra bit of Attack Damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Gathering Storm is your late game insurance policy for damage. If you fall behind, try stalling out the game by denying their tower siege with your Traps. The longer the game goes the better shot you have of coming back with Gathering Storm.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 10 min. gain AP or AD, Adaptive.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD
20 min: + 24 AP or 14 AD
30 min: + 48 AP or 29 AD
40 min: + 80 AP or 48 AD
50 min: + 120 AP or 72 AD
60 min: + 168 AP or 101 AD
etc...
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Every 10 minutes gain stacking AP or AD.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.24
patch.description: Patch 7.24 is the first major balance pass at the new rune system and touches a number of of runes throughout including buffs to Fleet Feetwork and Phase Rush, nerfs to Press the Attack and Triumph and many more.

primary_data.stone_why: As Blitz you can easily proc Aftershock to continue fighting. The explosion further assist in kill potential.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Damage: 40-140 (+3.5% your maximum health)
Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: This Blitz loadout focuses on snowball and Demolish lets you punish the enemy by taking towers after killing them, further pushing your lead.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Charge up a powerful attack against a tower over 4s, when within 600 range of it. The charged attack deals 125 (+30% of your max health) bonus physical damage.

Cooldown: 45s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tower burst damage based on max health.

primary_data.stone_why: Early fighting (especially level 2) heavily relies on armor to mitigate minion damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: As a melee support you're often going to be taking poke/harass damage from ranged mage supports. Second Wind helps you sustain through some of the poke so that you're still able to take those all-ins when you land a hook.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

secondary_data.stone_why: Flashtraption on Blitz allows you to get the jump on your opponent at unsuspecting times by controlling bushing and flashing out into them

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
While Flash is on cooldown it is replaced by Hexflash.

Hexflash: Channel for 2.5 seconds to blink to a new location.

Cooldown: 20 seconds. Goes on a 10 second cooldown when you enter champion combat.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain a channel flash while flash is on cooldown.

secondary_data.stone_why: Future's Market on Blitz allows you to snowball your gold lead from successful hook kills by finishing your big purchases sooner.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
You can enter debt to buy items. The amount you can borrow increases over time.

Debt limit: 150 + 5/min
Lending Fee: 50 gold per item

patch.title: Patch 7.24
patch.description: Patch 7.24 is the first major balance pass at the new rune system and touches a number of of runes throughout including buffs to Fleet Feetwork and Phase Rush, nerfs to Press the Attack and Triumph and many more.

primary_data.stone_why: Grasp on Malphite allows you to trade effectively with auto attacks in lane. Each point of health is especially important/strong on Malphite thanks to having so much natural Armor.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 4s in combat, your next basic attack on a champion will:

  • Deal bonus damage equal to 4% of your max health
  • Heal you for 2% of your max health
  • Permanently increase your health by 5

Ranged Champions: Damage and healing are halved and gain 2 permanent health instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus damage / heal based on max health. Permanent max health.

primary_data.stone_why: Unflinching bonus Tenacity and Slow Resist allow you to stick to your target after using [R] for repeated Grasp procs and kill pressure.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance by 10% for each Summoner Spell on cooldown. After casting a Summoner Spell, gain 15% additional Tenacity and Slow Resistance for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

primary_data.stone_why: If you manage to make it through the early game, Conditioning's bonus resists make a monster and incredibly difficult to kill in the mid game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: Overgrowth's bonus health scales incredibly well with Malphite's natural Armor stacking. Each point of health you earn from Overgrowth is that much stronger thanks to your resists.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 8 monsters or enemy minions that die near you permanently increases your max health by 0.2%.

Range: 1400 units
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Minions that die nearby give max health.

secondary_data.stone_why: The primary reason you pick Malphite is for the incredibly strong engage potential with his [R]. The more often your [R] is up the more chances you have for kills and safety when getting ganked.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

secondary_data.stone_why: Malphite's natural build consists of a lot of Cooldown Reduction items and Transcendence allows you to overcome any fear of over-capping CDR. The extra bit of AP you'll get from over-capping is welcomed.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Electrocute's extra bit of burst damage allows you to finish off a kill to get the resets going.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Kat's [E] is a reliable blink that, when paired with Sudden Impact, grants the Magic Penetration needed to assassinate your target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: This loadout is all about kills and snowballing and Eyeball Collection is the rune here that does just that.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain an adaptive bonus of 0.6 Attack Damage or 1 Ability Power, per eyeball collected.

Upon completing your collection at 20 eyeballs, gain an adaptive bonus of 6 Attack Damage, or 10 Ability Power.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Kat naturally likes Spell Vamp as her abilities deal a high amount of base damage and she needs to get up close and personal.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Healing: 2.5% + 2.5% per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Triumph's extra burst of healing allows you to continue resetting your abilities and killing as many people as possible.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace is the go-to rune when looking to finish off squishy targets quickly. The bonus execution damage synergizes well with Katarina's assassination playstyle.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

primary_data.stone_why: Nocturne synergizes well with Dark Harvest's front-loaded burst and power-farming nature. He's able to pick up a stack and effectively utilize it by getting into range of an [R]. The massive burst from your ganks with Dark Harvest makes kill on squishy targets very effective.

Soul Charged lasts 20s, increased to 300s after collecting 150 soul essence.

Bonus damage: 40 - 80 (+0.25 bonus AD) (+0.2 AP) + soul essence collected.

Champion souls - 6 soul essence.
Monster souls - 2 soul essence.
Minion souls - 4 soul essence.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Nearby dying large minions / monsters / champions grants burst damage.

primary_data.stone_why: Aftershock provides a lot of survivability and bonus damage for Maokai when engaging/fighting with [Q], [W], and [R].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Damage: 40-140 (+3.5% your maximum health)
Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: Maokai is a top laner who stacks a lot of health and is able to proc Font of Life with every single one of his abilities, to multiple targets.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them for 4s.

Ally champions who attack marked enemies heal for 5 + 1% of your max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Allies heal when attacking enemies you impair | Think old Stoneborne Pact.

primary_data.stone_why: Conditioning's bonus Armor and Magic Resist synergizes and scales well with the bonus resists from Aftershock, allowing you to survive massive amount of damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: Revitalize empower's Maokai's passive and Font of Life healing for incredibly strong drawn-out team fights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

secondary_data.stone_why: Perfect Timing is a rune that serves double duty as a a get-out-jail card and raw gold value towards a quicker Gargoyle's Stoneplate.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

secondary_data.stone_why: Magical Footwear is a pretty safe rune choice on just about any champion as it effectively acts as free kill's worth of gold at the 10min mark.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: You get Slightly Magical Boots at 10 min, but you cannot buy boots before then. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free boots at 10 minutes.

Shield is built up from 40% of excess healing from self, or 300% of excess healing from allies.

build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Second Wind's reliable heath sustain allows you to sustain early trades and out-heal your opponent.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

secondary_data.stone_why: The early Armor from Iron skin further empowers your ability to take early trades and come out ahead.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: [Q] spam on Taliyah allows her to repeatedly proc Comet and reduce it's cooldown quickly.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Band is your replacement for Meditation for lane harass mana sustain.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch on Taliyah allows you to abuse your poking pressure in lane with repeated [Q]s, proccing Scorch ever time it comes off cooldown for massive building damage and lane pressure.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Triumph on Taliyah allows you to dish out damage, pick up kills, and continue on the in action for more kills thanks to the massive heal.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace on Taliyah empowers your ability to dish out huge amount of damage thanks to the super low cooldown on [Q], on low health targets who are running for their life.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

patch.title: Patch 7.24
patch.description: Patch 7.24 is the first major balance pass at the new rune system and touches a number of of runes throughout including buffs to Fleet Feetwork and Phase Rush, nerfs to Press the Attack and Triumph and many more.

primary_data.stone_why: Thanks to multiple auto-attack resets on [Q] Camille can easily proc Press the Attack for great dueling damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 consecutive basic attacks will deal 30 - 120 bonus adaptive damage (based on level) and makes them vulnerable, increasing the damage they take by 12% from all sources for 6s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Camille has a number of means of building herself an over-shield via Doran's Blade, [W] on champions, and Titantic Hydra, allowing her to enter duels with a health lead.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Excess healing on you becomes a shield, for up to 10% of your total health + 10.

Shield is built up from 40% of excess healing from self, or 300% of excess healing from allies.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Excess incoming heals become a shield (includes lifesteal etc.)

primary_data.stone_why: Camille's primary means of losing a duel is typically getting CCed so she can't return damage. Any additional Tenacity improves her dueling that much more.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 5% tenacity plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Cut Down is the ultimate go-to for shredding big beefy tanks with a ton of health.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Deal 4% more damage to champions with 150 more max health than you, increasing to 10% at 2000 more max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tank killer

secondary_data.stone_why: Iron Skin is a great early-game option for trading in lane and winning fights against heavy AD comps.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

secondary_data.stone_why: Revitalize is a great laning rune when you're looking to trade often and come out healthy, winning the attrition war.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +130 Health
