patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Unbreakable Freljord Heart
builds.description: Shields, heals, and all about the tankiness.

primary_data.stone_why: Braum naturally spends a lot of time near his teammates thanks to his [W] and [E]. The shield Provided by Guardian allows you and your AD Carry to absorb a bit of damage before you start blocking with [E].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Guard allies within 175 units of you, and Guard allies you target with spells for 2.5s. While Guarding, if you or the ally would take damage, both of you gain a shield and are hasted for 1.5s.

Cooldown: 45s
Shield Strength: 60 - 150 (+0.20 AP) (+10% bonus health).
Haste: 20% increased Movement Speed
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Haste and shield allies you are near or cast a spell on.

primary_data.stone_why: Between his Passive, [Q], and [R] Braum has a number of means of marking enemies for healing with Font of Life.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them for 4s.

Ally champions who attack marked enemies heal for 5 + 1% of your max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Allies heal when attacking enemies you impair | Think old Stoneborne Pact.

primary_data.stone_why: Braum spends a lot of time and health blocking auto attacks with [E] resulting in him taking a majority of Physical damage. Iron Skin allows you to come out the other end of that healthy.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: Second Wind's massive mid-fight health sustain allows you to absorb the brunt of your team's incoming damage when your [E] is up and come out the other side healthy enough to keep fighting.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

secondary_data.stone_why: The massive bonus health from Celestial Body contributes to the healing and shielding on Font of Life and Guardian.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+100 Health permanently
-10% damage to champions and monsters until 10 mins.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +100 health | Less damage until 10 minutes.

secondary_data.stone_why: Magical Footwear is an interesting rune choice in that it can often be seen as a raw value of 350g allowing you to invest that into other items.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: You get Slightly Magical Boots at 10 min, but you cannot buy boots before then. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free boots at 10 minutes.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

patch.title: Patch 7.24
patch.description: Patch 7.24 is the first major balance pass at the new rune system and touches a number of of runes throughout including buffs to Fleet Feetwork and Phase Rush, nerfs to Press the Attack and Triumph and many more.

primary_data.stone_why: Arcane Comet is a solid offensive rune choice for Jhin thanks to its high Bonus AD scaling. If procced when using [W] for a root or [R], it's almost guaranteed to hit.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Band provides you the mana sustain so you can start Doran's Blade instead of the typical Doran's Ring.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: Jhin is one of the fastest moving AD Carries in the game thanks to his passive, Zeal stacking, and tendency to build Ghostblade allowing you to position better for your 4th shot.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch is an all-around solid lane harass rune. You should be able to proc it relatively easily with [Q] or [W].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Biscuit Delivery offer you an immense amount of health sustain during the laning phase to help you overcome to sometime oppressive amounts of poke and harass in the early game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Biscuit Delivery: Gain a Total Biscuit of Everlasting will every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes.

Biscuits restore 15% of your missing health and mana and increase your mana cap by 40 mana permanently.

Champions without mana restore 20% missing energy instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Periodically gain a biscuit with strong Health/Mana regen.

secondary_data.stone_why: Cosmic Insight's extra bit of CDR helps to empower your role as a long range utility AD Carry.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description:

Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.24
patch.description: Patch 7.24 is the first major balance pass at the new rune system and touches a number of of runes throughout including buffs to Fleet Feetwork and Phase Rush, nerfs to Press the Attack and Triumph and many more.

primary_data.stone_why: Jhin loves the healing from Fleet Footwork for sustain, but the movement speed to get into 4th shot range is the real kicker here.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Attacking a moving builds Energy stacks. At 100 stacks, your next attack is Energized.

Energized attacks heal you for 3 - 60 (+0.30 bonus AD, +0.40 AP) and grant 30% increased Movement Speed for 1s.

Healing is 60% as effective when used on a minion.
If the attack that activates Fleet Footwork is a critical hit, Fleet Footwork's healing is increased by 40% of your critical damage modifier
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Lane sustain | Engage Movement. Think old Warlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Thanks to Fleet Footwork it's quite easy to gain a reliable shield to keep you healthy in small trades.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Excess healing on you becomes a shield, for up to 10% of your total health + 10.

Shield is built up from 40% of excess healing from self, or 300% of excess healing from allies.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Excess incoming heals become a shield (includes lifesteal etc.)

primary_data.stone_why: Attack Speed on Jhin acts as a great AD multiplier, combined with Absolute Focus and Gathering Storm

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Jhin's 4th shot execution damage pattern screams for you to take Coup De Grace so you can quickly and painless execute your target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Flat Attack Damage on Jhin scales incredibly well with the attack speed multiplier on his passive, and Absolute Focus grants us just that.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: While above 70% health, gain an adaptive bonus of up to 24 Attack Damage or 40 Ability Power (based on level).
build_keystone.stone_short_description: When above 70% health, gain extra AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: With Jhin's passive acting as an Attack Damage modifier, you'll be hitting insane AD numbers in the late game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 10 min. gain AP or AD, Adaptive.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD
20 min: + 24 AP or 14 AD
30 min: + 48 AP or 29 AD
40 min: + 80 AP or 48 AD
50 min: + 120 AP or 72 AD
60 min: + 168 AP or 101 AD
etc...
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Every 10 minutes gain stacking AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: As a pseudo AD Carry jungler, Kindred is naturally able to proc the bonus damage along side their [E] for a strong bit of burst damage.

build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Triumph is the best rune in the group for Kindred as it pairs pretty nicely, when fighting to the death, with the last bit of healing from [R] topping you off to either escape of keep truckin'.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Tenacity as a Jungler means that you're less likely to get a gank stuffed by CC when entering a lane that already had vision of you. In team fights the Tenacity simple means more uptime on damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 5% tenacity plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Kindred likes to shred her targets and kill them as fast as possible. Coup De Grace is one of the more reliable damage sources in this group.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Kindred can make good use of both the Lethality for autos and Magic Penetration for Wolf damage, when casting [Q].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

secondary_data.stone_why: Zombie Ward is a safe a reliable rune on every Jungle thanks to the nature of their vision control and ability to deep ward.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place. Additionally, when your wards expire, they resurrect as Zombie Wards.

Zombie Wards are visible, last for 180s, and don't count towards your ward limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Wards you place / kill spawn a visible ward when they die.

primary_data.stone_why: Elise has a very assassain-heavy play style so Electrocute suits her well as she can quickly and easily proc it.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: In spider form, Elise's [Q] acts as a dash granting her BOTH Magic Pen. and Lethality, making her [W] autos do a ton of damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: Jungle's live and die by ward control throughout the jungle so why not be rewarded with more damage by doing so?

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain an adaptive bonus of 0.6 Attack Damage or 1 Ability Power, per eyeball collected.

Upon completing your collection at 20 eyeballs, gain an adaptive bonus of 6 Attack Damage, or 10 Ability Power.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Combined with her [W] in spider form, Elise can out duel most other Junglers in 1v1 situations thanks to all of this combined healing.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Healing: 2.5% + 2.5% per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Elise loves CDR in her item build, largely because if she is able to get multiple spell rotations off in a skirmish, she's sure to win.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Waterwalking is an interesting rune choice in that it gives you a lot of power in a very specific scenario. Control the jungle and take fights near the river to win them all.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 25 Movement Speed and an adaptive bonus of up to 18 Attack Damage or 30 Ability Power (based on level) when in the river.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain MS and AP or AD, when in the river.

primary_data.stone_why: Aery is an incredibly reliable source of damage in the early to mid game. It's also very strong in scrappy fights thanks to the bonus shielding on your [E].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging enemies or shielding allies.

Damage: 15 - 40 based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD)
Shield: 30 - 80 based on level (+0.25 AP and +0.4 bonus AD)

Aery cannot be sent out to again until she returns to you.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks/abilities summon Aery to damage enemies / shield allies.

primary_data.stone_why: Spamming abilities for lane pressure is Ori's forte and Manaflow Band enables her to do so very regularly.

Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

secondary_data.stone_why: Cosmic Insight synergies very well with both Transcendence for CDR and Perfect Timing for a lower Zhonya's cooldown.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD
20 min: + 24 AP or 14 AD
30 min: + 48 AP or 29 AD
40 min: + 80 AP or 48 AD
50 min: + 120 AP or 72 AD
60 min: + 168 AP or 101 AD
etc...
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Every 10 minutes gain stacking AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Nasus is all about opening the gates. Demolish + [Q] means you're shredding towers in no-time.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Charge up a powerful attack against a tower over 4s, when within 600 range of it. The charged attack deals 125 (+30% of your max health) bonus physical damage.

Cooldown: 45s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tower burst damage based on max health.

secondary_data.stone_why: Second Wind is a great sustain rune when playing into difficult match-ups. Like Doran's Shield, it allows you to mitigate a lot of the chip damage you might take.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +130 Health

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: On the Prowl
builds.description: Map mobility, power farming, and assassination.

primary_data.stone_why: Nidalee often acts a lot like an assassin, wanting to land a spear and blow up her target quickly. A Spear->Pounce->Swipe will instantly proc the Electro cute for a ton of damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Nidalee's high mobility with Pounce allows her to keep the Magic Penetration and Lethality buff up at almost all times.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: As an assassin, you're wanting to pick up kills around the map from as early in the game as you can. Doubling down on that, we can take Eyeball here for even more power to snowball.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain an adaptive bonus of 0.6 Attack Damage or 1 Ability Power, per eyeball collected.

Upon completing your collection at 20 eyeballs, gain an adaptive bonus of 6 Attack Damage, or 10 Ability Power.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Nidlee is a Jungler who excels at clearing her jungle insanely quickly and getting around the map to find any fight she wants.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 8 out of combat Movement Speed plus 8 per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Out of Combat Move Speed stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Celerity synergizes pretty well with Nidalee's passive, granting you more AP when entering a bush. The bonus Movement Speed also furthers your ability to get to fights anywhere on the map.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Waterwalking is one of the highest value runes if you can take advantage of and abuse it while in the river.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 25 Movement Speed and an adaptive bonus of up to 18 Attack Damage or 30 Ability Power (based on level) when in the river.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain MS and AP or AD, when in the river.

rune_main.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Fury of the Tiger
builds.description: Tiger Stance: Massive jungle control and rapid bleed stacking.

primary_data.stone_why: With a Tiger Stance focused build, Press the Attack synergizes incredibly well with your ability to quickly proc the exposure damage and stack the bleeds for rapidly increasing damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 consecutive basic attacks will deal 30 - 120 bonus adaptive damage (based on level) and makes them vulnerable, increasing the damage they take by 12% from all sources for 6s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attack burst | Teammates deal bonus damage to target.

primary_data.stone_why: Triumph allows you to dive into the enemy and slice them up in teamfights and keep on going thanks to the massive heal after each kill.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: More Attack Speed means a faster/healthier jungle clear, more map control, and much faster kills/stack of Press the Attack.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace is the go-to rune for slicing up squishy targets as quickly as possible. The execution damage allows your double-stacked bleeds to hit like a truck.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Celerity empowers your ability to traverse the map much more quickly than otherwise possible, allowing you to power-farm and hit item/level power-spikes way sooner than the enemy is expecting.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: Waterwalking furthers your ability to control the jungle with map presence. The extra AD also allows you to sneak some early dragons/Rift Herald for more objective control.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 25 Movement Speed and an adaptive bonus of up to 18 Attack Damage or 30 Ability Power (based on level) when in the river.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain MS and AP or AD, when in the river.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Grasp on Poppy allows her to trade incredibly well in lane and sustain a ton of damage thanks to her massive resist stacking. The heal and bonus health from Grasp make every point of health much stronger due to those resists.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 4s in combat, your next basic attack on a champion will:

  • Deal bonus damage equal to 4% of your max health
  • Heal you for 2% of your max health
  • Permanently increase your health by 5

Ranged Champions: Damage and healing are halved and gain 2 permanent health instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus damage / heal based on max health. Permanent max health.

primary_data.stone_why: Poppy's biggest pitfall is her lack of mobility. She can be a threat to squishy champions if she is able to stick to them. Unflinching's Tenacity/Slow Resist allows you to dive the backline and stick to them for kill threat.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance by 10% for each Summoner Spell on cooldown. After casting a Summoner Spell, gain 15% additional Tenacity and Slow Resistance for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

primary_data.stone_why: Conditioning's duo resist buff at 10mins synergizes well with the additional resists from [W] making you incredibly tanky and resilient in the mid-game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: Second Wind's in-combat health regen allows you to take some scrappy duels after 10min and sustain any small bit of damage you take.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

secondary_data.stone_why: Triumph on a tank allows you to hold your ground as the front-line in teamfights for an incredibly long time by just picking up assists.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Legend: Tenacity further empowers your ability to ignore enemy CC and become an unstoppable front-line tank.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 5% tenacity plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Aftershock is a fantastic keystone choice for Gragas because it provides him with the defenses needed in an engage, as well as a bit of extra offensive power with the explosion.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After immobilizing an enemy champion, increase your current Armor and Magic Resist by 10 + 30% for 2.5s. Then, after 2.5s deal magic damage to nearby enemies.

Damage: 40-140 (+3.5% your maximum health)
Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Immobilizations grant Armor / MR and casts explosion based on health.

primary_data.stone_why: Gragas can very easily apply Font of Life to a large number of targets from his [Q], [E], and [R] results in a lot of healing in teamfights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them for 4s.

Ally champions who attack marked enemies heal for 5 + 1% of your max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Allies heal when attacking enemies you impair | Think old Stoneborne Pact.

primary_data.stone_why: Gragas naturally builds a good amount of health and that health is multiplicative with every defensive stat he gets from Conditioning.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: Revitalize synergizes incredibly well increasing the healing of both Gragas' passive and Font of Life healing.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

secondary_data.stone_why: Now this is largely a stylistic choice rune. Because Gragas likes to burn his flash as often as possible for an engage, Hex Flash gives you the option to find other entrances into a to lane gank when Flash in on cooldown.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
While Flash is on cooldown it is replaced by Hexflash.

Hexflash: Channel for 2.5 seconds to blink to a new location.

Cooldown: 20 seconds. Goes on a 10 second cooldown when you enter champion combat.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain a channel flash while flash is on cooldown.

secondary_data.stone_why: Through the combination of itemization and skill kit, Gragas can very effectively make use of every CDR stat on Cosmic Insight.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description:

Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

primary_data.stone_why: Jinx is all about that Attack Speed, especially with Mini-gun. Lethal Tempo will also provide a lot of extra damage in Rocket form as well, helping you overcome the natural attack speed slow.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
1.5s after damaging a champion gain 30 - 80% Attack Speed (based on level) for 3s. Attacking a champion extends the effect to 6s.

Cooldown: 6s

Lethal Tempo allows you to temporarily exceed the attack speed limit.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tons of attack speed | Exceeds Attack Speed limit.

primary_data.stone_why: Jinx's passive synergizes incredibly well with Triumph, keeping you healthy enough after a close fight to move onto the next target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

primary_data.stone_why: Moar attacks means moar damage. We're all about that.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 3% Attack Speed plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attack Speed stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

primary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace is the reliable go-to rune when looking to do maximum damage to squishy targets. The extra bit of Attack Damage after a kill also synergizes well with Jinx's passive to reset for more kills.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

secondary_data.stone_why: Celerity's extra bit of movement speed is a great passive stat for all AD Carries as it allows you to reposition in fights more accurately and swiftly.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: AD Carries are typically the late-game insurance policy where they kick into gear and take over post 30 minutes. Gather Storm further empowers that role to help you in killing any target you set your sights on in long games.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 10 min. gain AP or AD, Adaptive.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD

etc...

builds.title: Be Their Undoing
builds.description: Oppressive lane harass and efficient power-spikes.

primary_data.stone_why: Arcane Comet can really shine on poke champions who are able to proc the effect from a long distance.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: Manaflow Band is what makes Xerath Support possible. His [Q] and [W] mana costs are extremely high with without Manaflow you're going to struggle poking and harassing in lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: As an AP damage support you won't be opting for nearly as many CDR items as you would otherwise. Transcendence allows you to still 30-40% CDR in teh mid-game while building more AP heavy items.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch is the bread-and-butter of Xerath support as it further empowers your poking and oppressive damage in lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Magical Footwear is a valuable and safe rune option on nearly all champions (minus roaming supports), acting effectively as a kill's worth of gold at 10mins.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: You get Slightly Magical Boots at 10 min, but you cannot buy boots before then. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free boots at 10 minutes.

secondary_data.stone_why: More CDR means more spell casts/poke and thus more lane harass, playing up on your strengths.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

builds.title: The Brink of Infinity
builds.description: Lane poke pressure and back-line teamfight damage.

primary_data.stone_why: Comet's poking nature allows you to repeatedly proc Comet for additional harass damage. If procced with [W] or [E] you're much more likely to Lane the Comet thanks to the slow/stun.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Damaging a champion with an ability hurls a comet at their location, or, if Arcane Comet is on cooldown, reduces it’s remaining cooldown.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Hitting spells hurls a comet at enemies.

primary_data.stone_why: Manaflow combined with Xerath's passive provides you massive mana sustain. Xerath has massive mana costs on [Q] and [W] so make sure to use those abilities to get the refund.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Every 75 seconds, your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded, and restores 10% of your missing mana or energy.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free spell cast every 60s and mana sustain.

primary_data.stone_why: Transcendence allows Xerath to hit 30% CDR with Morello's alone for a massively powerful mid-game poke and harass.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Xerath excels at poking in lane and Scorch is the ultimate lane dominance rune. Combined with Comet, Scorch should easily put your target in Coup De Grace range very quickly.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: Triumph is an all-around solid rune choice on any champion. The extra heal on kill/assists allows you to continue on in fights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace is the go-to rune for mid-lane mages who are looking to pump out maximum damage to back-line targets.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

builds.title: Savor the Misery
builds.description: Top lane dominance and unstoppable tankiness.

primary_data.stone_why: Tahm's incredibly strong slow on [Q] allows him to chase down and trade incredibly well in lane with auto attacks. The stacking health on Grasp further empowers his passive.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 4s in combat, your next basic attack on a champion will:

  • Deal bonus damage equal to 4% of your max health
  • Heal you for 2% of your max health
  • Permanently increase your health by 5

Ranged Champions: Damage and healing are halved and gain 2 permanent health instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus damage / heal based on max health. Permanent max health.

primary_data.stone_why: Tahm's biggest downfall is how incredibly immobile and prone to CC/slowing he is. The bonus Tenacity/Slow Resist makes you incredibly hard to het away from once you have Righteous Glory and Mercury's Treads.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance by 10% for each Summoner Spell on cooldown. After casting a Summoner Spell, gain 15% additional Tenacity and Slow Resistance for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

primary_data.stone_why: This slot is highly dependent on lane matchup and enemy composition. If you think you can get away with an easy lane (Maokai etc.) you can opt for a greedier choice in Conditioning.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: +5 Armor | Healing increase Armor temporarily.

primary_data.stone_why: Overgrowth is a rune that allows Tahm to scale, both defensively and offensively, incredibly well. The bonus stacking health further empowers your autos and abilities thanks to Tahm's Passive.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 8 monsters or enemy minions that die near you permanently increases your max health by 0.2%.

Range: 1400 units
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Minions that die nearby give max health.

secondary_data.stone_why: Triumph is a rune that is deceptively good in it's ability to sustain in teamfights. If you're playing frontline and soaking damage, picking up assists will massively heal you to keep moving forward.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Especially during the laning phase, Tahm relies heavily on the ability to take trades by getting as many autos off as possible. The faster autos means more damage from passive, Grasp, and faster passive stacks.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.

primary_data.stone_why: Like Braum, the combination of [Q] slow and Tahm's natural health stacking allows you to provide decent healing in lane fights.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them for 4s.

Ally champions who attack marked enemies heal for 5 + 1% of your max health.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Allies heal when attacking enemies you impair | Think old Stoneborne Pact.

primary_data.stone_why: The Armor and Magic Resist of Conditioning pairs very well with champions who buy an early Locket to make for a strong mid-game teamfight.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.

Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

*Include heals and shields cast on yourself*
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Stronger heals and shields.

secondary_data.stone_why: Approach Velocity is a great rune on Tahm to assist getting into range to [W] a CCed teammate, and for follow-up chase and damage on an enemy you have hit with [Q].

Range: 1000
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Movement speed towards impaired allies / enemies.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:

Biscuits restore 15% of your missing health and mana and increase your mana cap by 40 mana permanently.

Champions without mana restore 20% missing energy instead.

primary_data.stone_why: Arcane Comet has a low cooldown allowing Ahri to proc it repetitively in lane for harassment damage.

Adaptive damage: 30 - 100 based on level (+0.20 AP and +0.35 bonus AD)

Cooldown: 20 - 8s

Cooldown Reduction:
- Single Target: 20%
- Area of Effect: 10%
- Damage Over Time: 5%

primary_data.stone_why: Ahri's ultimate grants her incredible kill potential and lane safety. Having it off cooldown as often as possible is fantastic for her.

build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

primary_data.stone_why: Transcendence is a great rune choice for most mages as repetitive spell casts is the majority of their damage, and pairs well with Ultimate Hat.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch is a rune that is incredibly reliable and provides the damage needed to eek out lane dominance.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.

secondary_data.stone_why: Magical footwear is a great choice on any champion loadout as it can be seen as simple earning 350g at level 10, which is always good. Ahri can also make great use of the bonus movespeed.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: You get Slightly Magical Boots at 10 min, but you cannot buy boots before then. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.

Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Each percent of CDR exceeding the CDR limit is converted to an adaptive bonus of 1.2 Attack Damage or 2 Ability Power.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Free 10% CDR at level 10 | Excess CDR becomes AP or AD.

secondary_data.stone_why: This loadout is all about pumping out as much damage as possible and there is no rune that does this better than the scaling nature of Gathering Storm. Ez doesn't usually build a lot of raw AD so Storm does a great job of making up for that in long games.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 10 min. gain AP or AD, Adaptive.

10 min: + 8 AP or 5 AD
20 min: + 24 AP or 14 AD
30 min: + 48 AP or 29 AD
40 min: + 80 AP or 48 AD
50 min: + 120 AP or 72 AD
60 min: + 168 AP or 101 AD
etc...
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Every 10 minutes gain stacking AP or AD.

rune_main.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Money in the Bank
builds.description: Money-making, weak early, and accelerated item scaling.

primary_data.stone_why: Kleptomancy procs exactly like Sheen resulting in Ezreal being one of the biggest abusers of the proc though the use of [Q].

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After using an ability, your next attack on a champion grants bonus gold. There's a chance you'll also gain a consumable.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks after spells on champions grant gold and consumables | Procs like Sheen.

primary_data.stone_why: Klepto potions plus Biscuits means you shouldn't have to purchase many potions at all with earned gold, letting you bypass the Lending fee of Future's Market and hit item power-spikes insanely early.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Biscuit Delivery: Gain a Total Biscuit of Everlasting will every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes.

Biscuits restore 15% of your missing health and mana and increase your mana cap by 40 mana permanently.

Champions without mana restore 20% missing energy instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Periodically gain a biscuit with strong Health/Mana regen.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
You can enter debt to buy items. The amount you can borrow increases over time.

Debt limit: 150 + 5/min
Lending Fee: 50 gold per item
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Enter debt to buy items early.

primary_data.stone_why: Ezreal probably loves CDR more than any other AD Carry does. CDR means more survivability and way more damage. The slight Summoner cooldown also provides safety in your weak early game.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

secondary_data.stone_why: Triumph allows you to stick to the edges of teamfights to pick off kills and assists, even when low health and continue on fighting. In early lane fights the heal can be the difference between a double kill and losing lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace allows you to snipe and pick off low health targets with the massive damage of your [Q].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

rune_main.rune_description:
Inspiration + Resolve: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +145 Health
Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

rune_secondary.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

patch.title: Patch 7.23
patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

primary_data.stone_why: Thanks to Morde's close range and multiple DoTs ([W] and [R]), you're able to repeatedly proc Aery in extended trades for very reliable damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging enemies or shielding allies.

Damage: 15 - 40 based on level (+0.10 AP and +0.15 bonus AD)
Shield: 30 - 80 based on level (+0.25 AP and +0.4 bonus AD)

Aery cannot be sent out to again until she returns to you.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Attacks/abilities summon Aery to damage enemies / shield allies.

primary_data.stone_why: Mordekaiser has no mana costs, making his use of a rune like Manaflow Band completely useless. More [R]s from Ultimate Hat means more kill threat and lane pressure damage.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

primary_data.stone_why: The bonus Movement Speed from Celerity is especially useful in scenarios for Mordekaiser because a large majority of his damage comes from being able to stick to his target.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Scorch is a fantastic lane dominance rune that provides a lot of damage for early trades/fights. Look to proc the bonus damage with an [E] every time is comes off of cooldown.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Your next ability hit sets champions on fire dealing 30 - 60 bonus magic damage based on level after 1s.

Cooldown: 20s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Extra Poke damage from abilities.

secondary_data.stone_why: As a short-range bruiser you wind up soaking a lot of damage in fights. The bonus healing form Triumph helps a lot in absorbing that damage, picking up kills/assists, and still being able to continue on in the fight.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace help you scale into the mid to late game with reliable damage that with significantly help take out squishy targets that you manage to get on top of.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

rune_main.rune_description: +15 attack damage or +25 ability power, adaptive

rune_secondary.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Their Tomb Awaits
builds.description: Massive tower pressure and lane dueling.

primary_data.stone_why: Yorick's trading/fighting pattern relies heavily on [Q], therefore auto attacks. Grasp's heal and bonus damage keep you healthy and empower longer duration duels.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 4s in combat, your next basic attack on a champion will:

  • Deal bonus damage equal to 4% of your max health
  • Heal you for 2% of your max health
  • Permanently increase your health by 5

Ranged Champions: Damage and healing are halved and gain 2 permanent health instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus damage / heal based on max health. Permanent max health.

primary_data.stone_why: Demolish empowers and emphasizes Yorick's ability to split push and shred towers. If you're left alone by the enemy team you'll have the ability to take several towers if not responded to.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Charge up a powerful attack against a tower over 4s, when within 600 range of it. The charged attack deals 125 (+30% of your max health) bonus physical damage.

Cooldown: 45s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tower burst damage based on max health.

primary_data.stone_why: Conditioning is the greedy rune in this slot. Yorick has strong early laning if you play around your Ghouls well allowing you to pressure safely without the early resists.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: Second Wind is the rune of choice in this slot if you're looking to fight and take a lot of trades during lane.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

secondary_data.stone_why: Every point of Tenacity that you can pick up further empowers your ability to deal damage due to your lack of mobility and having to just run at the enemy.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain 5% tenacity plus an additional 1.5% for every Legend stack (max 10 stacks).

Earn progress toward Legend stacks for every champion takedown, epic monster takedown, large monster kill, and minion kill.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity stacks from CS / Kills / Assists

secondary_data.stone_why: Yorick does an impressive and unexpected amount of damage. Coup De Grace lets you put that damage to good use to secure kills.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD

rune_main.rune_description: +130 Health

rune_secondary.rune_description: +18% Attack Speed

patch.description: The first balance patch of the pre-season brings a much needed damage nerf to Summon Aery. The damage was just too high for how reliable it is. We also see a bit of a cooldown buff to Predator to hopefully bring it in line with the other Domination Keystones. Check out the exact numbers after the jump

builds.title: Another Unworthy Opponent
builds.description: Maximum damage, kill threat, and efficient power spikes.

primary_data.stone_why: Akali loves burst damage and she can quite easily proc Electrocute with a [Q]->Auto->[E].

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

Damage: 40-220 (+0.50 Bonus AD, +0.30 AP) damage.

Cooldown: 50-25s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 3 attacks / abilities burst | Think old Thunderlords.

primary_data.stone_why: Akali can make use of both the Magic Penetration and Lethality of Sudden Impact, while nearly always having the proc up with [W] and [R] casts.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
After exiting stealth or using a dash, leap, blink, or teleport, damage a champion to gain 10 Lethality and 8 Magic Penetration for 5s.

Cooldown: 4s
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Gain magic pen / lethality when using a gap closer or stealth.

primary_data.stone_why: Akali loves to kill and snowball. Eyeball Collect is perfect for bloody lanes/games where you're looking to run away with a lead.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain an adaptive bonus of 0.6 Attack Damage or 1 Ability Power, per eyeball collected.

Upon completing your collection at 20 eyeballs, gain an adaptive bonus of 6 Attack Damage, or 10 Ability Power.

Collect 2 eyeballs per champion takedown, 1 eyeball per ward takedown or assist.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists on champions and wards grants AP or AD.

primary_data.stone_why: Additional spell vamp on top of her passive and Gunblade healing makes Akali incredibly difficult to trade against.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Heal for a percentage of the damage dealt by your abilities.

Healing: 2.5% + 2.5% per Bounty Hunter stack.

Earn a Bounty Hunter stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.

AoE: Healing reduced to one third on AoE abilities.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Spell Vamp stacks from unique kills / assists.

secondary_data.stone_why: Perfect Timing serves as both a free stasis early if you find yourself in a sticky situation as well as a 600g item discount on a quicker full purchase. Paired with Future's Market you'll have the item completed sooner than the enemy expects.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

secondary_data.stone_why: An early kill or assist with Future's Market has the potential to slingshot you way ahead of your lane opponent if you manage to take an opportune recall timing to finish an item.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
You can enter debt to buy items. The amount you can borrow increases over time.

Debt limit: 150 + 5/min
Lending Fee: 50 gold per item
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Enter debt to buy items early.

rune_main.rune_description: +11 Attack Damage or +18 Ability Power, adaptive

Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive
Inspiration + Precision: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +20% Attack Speed

builds.title: The Marin Special(ist)
builds.description: All about the all-in. FLASHy engages. AP burst.

primary_data.stone_why: This build is ALL ABOUT flashing in with your ultimate and blowing people up. The 25% summoner CDR + Cosmic Insight puts Flash on a 180s cooldown.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Gain a Summoner Shard at 2 minutes and another every 6 min after (max 2 shards).

While near the shop, you can exchange 1 Summoner Shard to replace a Summoner Spell with a different one.

Additionally, your Summoner Spell cooldowns are reduced by 25%.

Smite: Buying Smite won't grant access to Smite items
You cannot have two of the same Summoner Spell
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Swap summoner spells in game. 25% Summoner CDR.

primary_data.stone_why: Perfect Timing gives you the safety of a large 5-man Flash->[R] without having to worry about getting blown up.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Start the game with a Commencing Stopwatch that transforms into a Stopwatch after 6 min. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

Reduces the cooldown of Zhonyas Hourglass, Guardian Angel, and Gargoyle's Stoneplate by 15%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 6 minutes gain a one-time use Zhonya’s active.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
You can enter debt to buy items. The amount you can borrow increases over time.

Debt limit: 150 + 5/min
Lending Fee: 50 gold per item
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Enter debt to buy items early.

primary_data.stone_why: More Summoner CDR means more Flash all-ins.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR
build_keystone.stone_short_description: 5% CDR for spells, Summoners, Items, and max CDR.

secondary_data.stone_why: Kennen is all about his [R], and this loadout in particular places heavy emphasis on spamming [R] and abusing your low Summoner cooldowns to take big teamfights immediately.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Your ultimate's cooldown is reduced by 5%. This number is increased by 2% each time your ultimate goes on cooldown. Stacks up to 5 times.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Scaling ultimate cooldown reduction.

secondary_data.stone_why: Celerity actually synergizes incredibly well with Kennen's kit. The bonus Movement Speed from [E] grants you a burst of extra Ability Power during your [R] all-ins.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Gain 3% increased Movement Speed and add 8% of your Bonus Movement Speed to your AP or AD (based on level), Adaptive.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Move speed | Bonus move speed grants AP or AD.

Inspiration + Domination: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power,adaptive
Inspiration + Sorcery: +20% Potion and Elixir Duration +16 Attack Damage or +27 Ability Power, adaptive

builds.title: Demacian Justice for All
builds.description: Efficient early lane trades and kill secure with [R].

primary_data.stone_why: Unfortunately Garen doesn't have any fantastic keystone choices, Grasp is just the best of the bad.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Every 4s in combat, your next basic attack on a champion will:

  • Deal bonus damage equal to 4% of your max health
  • Heal you for 2% of your max health
  • Permanently increase your health by 5

Ranged Champions: Damage and healing are halved and gain 2 permanent health instead.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Bonus damage / heal based on max health. Permanent max health.

primary_data.stone_why: The bonus tenacity and slow resistance will help you overcome Garen's biggest pitfall of getting kited by CC and slows.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance by 10% for each Summoner Spell on cooldown. After casting a Summoner Spell, gain 15% additional Tenacity and Slow Resistance for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Tenacity and slow resist based on summoner skill cooldown/usage.

primary_data.stone_why: Conditioning allows you to scale into the mid game as a very threatening tank.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After 10 min gain +8 Armor and +8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: After 10 minutes gain Armor and MR.

primary_data.stone_why: Second Wind synergizes incredibly well with Doran's shield and Garen's passive, allowing you to take numerous early trades and regen substantially.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: After taking damage from an enemy champion heal for 4% of your missing health over 10 seconds.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Getting hit restores missing health over time.

secondary_data.stone_why: Triumph's massive heal allows you to take the brunt of the enemy damage, as a front liner, and keep moving by picking up kills or an [R] execution.

build_keystone.stone_long_description: Takedowns restore 12% of your missing health and grant an additional 25 gold.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Kills / Assists restore health and give 25 gold. Think old Dangerous Game.

secondary_data.stone_why: Coup De Grace's execution nature synergizes very well with the execution damage pattern of Garen's [R], securing kills that may otherwise not be possible.

build_keystone.stone_long_description:
Deal 9% more damage to champions who have less than 40% health.

Additionally, takedowns on champions grant an adaptive bonus of 9 Attack Damage or 15 Ability Power for 10s.
build_keystone.stone_short_description: Execute damage | Kills / Assists grant temporary AP/AD
